name: Avalanche Peak - Crow River Route
introduction: This route makes a good weekend trip, all against a backdrop of some of the best features of Arthur’s Pass National Park – glaciers, mountain peaks and ice-fed rivers. Crow Hut is at the bush edge in an alpine meadow.

name: Arrowtown Chinese Settlement
introduction: One golden village, two tales. The picturesque preservation of two very different goldrush communities – Chinese and European – in a town that still thrives.

name: Blue Pools Track
introduction: Nestled among mature beech and podocarp forest, these pools of deep, clear water flowing into the Makarora River offer a moment of tranquillity. This is one of our best short walks.

name: A Frame Hut & Takapari Road Track
introduction: Head to Tamaki Road end by following the track up through forest to Takapari Road. From there you’ll follow a bulldozed road 100 m to the hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Ahuriri Estuary Walking Track
introduction: View a community of wading birds, fish, mud dwellers and aquatic plant life from the estuary track and boardwalk. Over 70 species of resident and migratory waterbirds use the estuary as a feeding and resting area.
mtbDuration: No mountain bikes allowed around the lower estuary

name: Alex Knob Track
introduction: It’s a 4-hour climb to the top of Alex Knob. The track zigzags up to Rata Lookout for a view of the Franz Josef Glacier. From there follow the marked track to the summit.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Arthur’s Pass Walking Track
introduction: Experience the best of Arthur’s Pass's diverse alpine vegetation, waterfalls, wetlands, rich history and stunning mountain views on this walk.

name: Avalanche Peak Route
introduction: Avalanche Peak is the only peak in Arthur's Pass that is marked by a poled route to the summit. The climb is 1,100 m vertical from the village (over just 2.5 km horizontal), and on a fine day, you will be rewarded with grand views of the surrounding peaks.

name: Big Bend Track
introduction: The Big Bend Track follows the Orongorongo River and connects the Orongorongo Track with the Whakanui Track.
walkDuration: 1 hr 30 min one way from Turere Bridge
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Baikie Hut Track
introduction: Baikie Hut makes a great picnic or overnight venue.
locationString: Lake Pukaki area, Ruataniwha Conservation Park

name: Blue Valley Track
introduction: This track is easily accessible and an interesting day or overnight trip.
locationString: Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Asbestos Cottage tracks
introduction: Walk to an historic cottage (built 1897) that was home to a reclusive couple for nearly 40 years.

name: Blue Lake walks
introduction: Enjoy one of the walks around historic, man-made Blue Lake in St Bathans and view sluicings and gold mining remains.

name: A’Deanes Bush Walk
introduction: Take a walk through beautiful native forest dominated by matai and kahikatea as well as a large tōtara tree. The reserve is on a flat river terrace.

name: Bannockburn Sluicings
introduction: This vanished landscape is New Zealand’s own wild west: The Bannockburn Sluicings are the scarred landscapes of a short-lived goldmining era.

name: Lake Brunner (Moana) (south) walks
introduction: Walk through wetlands around the shore of Lake Brunner, or to an impressive waterfall.

name: Aotea Track
introduction: The Aotea Track offers a range of spectacular landscapes, superb views and rich history.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Aratiatia Rapids tracks
introduction: Several times a day the gates at the Aratiatia dam are opened to release the full flow of the river - a spectacular sight from the lookout points. Stay safe and keep clear of the rapids at all times.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Atleys Track
introduction: You can see many historic gold mining features from Atleys Track and there are superb views from the summit of Mt Dewar.

name: Atene Skyline Track
introduction: The Atene Skyline Track has spectacular views and a campsite for trampers wanting to stay the night.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Ben Avon access route
introduction: This side trip off Ahuriri valley provides the opportunity to scale Ben Avon Peak in Ahuriri Conservation Park.

name: Beehive Creek Walkway
introduction: This walk follows a shallow creek through a mixture of native bush and exotics before crossing farmland.

name: Abel Tasman Coast Track
introduction: Enjoy the mild climate, golden beaches and lush coastal native bush on the Abel Tasman Coast Track.

name: Ben Lomond Track
introduction: The Ben Lomond Track is a demanding climb and a full day's hike with an 1,438 m elevation gain. On clear days trampers are rewarded at the summit with spectacular panoramic views.
walkDuration: 3-4 hr to Ben Lomond Saddle, 6-8 hr to Ben Lomond Summit

name: Aramoana Boardwalk
introduction: The Aramoana Boardwalk and saltmarsh experience, and other short walks from Aramoana on the edge of Otago Harbour, suit  all ages and abilities.

name: Big Tōtara Walk
introduction: This short walking track winds through forest to some of Southland’s largest and oldest tōtara trees in a forest that has never been logged.

name: Birch Creek access route
introduction: This public access route travels along Birch Creek in the Ahuriri valley.

name: Blue-Young Link Track
introduction: An extension of the very popular Blue Pools Walk and connects with the Young River. It's  also an alternative, high river route to the stat of the Gillespie Pass Circuit.

name: Borland Road to Monowai Hut Track
introduction: This tramping track leads from Borland Saddle to a hut at the northern end of Lake Monowai in Fiordland National Park.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Boundary Creek Track
introduction: A pleasant climb up an old musterers' track above an upland river gorge.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Buskin, Highcliff and Paradise Road tracks
introduction: Walk or mountain bike tracks from Highcliff Road.

name: Bluff Stream Kauri Loop Track
introduction: This track has been closed to prevent the spread of kauri dieback.

name: Brasell Point Nature Walk
introduction: This walking track in Deep Cove, Doubtful Sound, is a short, self guided nature walk through forest to the Helena Falls lookout.
locationString: Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park

name: Bridle Track
introduction: This well-graded track follows a section of the old Bridle Track, the first link between Otago and Westland.

name: Bushy Beach Track
introduction: Spot New Zealand fur seals/kekeno and yellow-eyed penguins/hoiho from this cliff-top walk.

name: Bridge to Nowhere Walk
introduction: Walk to an abandoned bridge in the heart of the Whanganui National Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Bullendale & Dynamo Hut Tracks
introduction: Traverse rugged Skippers Creek to see New Zealand’s first industrial hydro power scheme or take the trail to the heart of Skippers’ quartz reef mining history.

name: Butcher Track
introduction: Butcher Track provides magnificent views of the Wellington harbour and surrounding areas.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Butterfields Wetland Walk
introduction: Situated near the Hāwea River Swing Bridge this small loop track around the Butterfields Wildlife Management Area is suitable for biking, running and walking.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Canavans Knob Walk
introduction: A short climb with rewarding views of the glacier, mountains and river flats.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Camp Stream Hut Track
introduction: The steep climb to Camp Stream Hut is part of Te Araroa  Trail and is popular with people walking the trail over summer and with ski tourers over winter.
locationString: Lake Tekapo area, Te Kahui Kaupeka Conservation Park

name: Boyd Creek Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Milford Road up the Boyd Creek onto the tops of the Countess Range, in the Snowdon Forest area.
locationString: Milford Road/Milford Sound area, Snowdon Forest Conservation Area

name: Braemar Road to Landslip Creek
introduction: A public access easement leads to Landslip Creek above Lake Pukaki.

name: Cloustons Mine Track
introduction: Walk this track as part of a day walk circuit from Flora car park.
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: Cloudy Peak Track
introduction: The Cloudy Peak Track from its 1526 m high point, provides fantastic views of the Upper Clutha plains and peaks of the Lindis and St Bathans ranges.
locationString: Dry Creek and Neinei i kura Conservation Areas
locationArray: Dry Creek and Neinei i kura Conservation Areas

name: Lake Rotoiti Circuit
introduction: Walk around Lake Rotoiti surrounded by high mountain peaks – with the option to catch a water taxi one way or to stay overnight in a hut, it's a great option for families with children.
distance: 23 km (with river crossing) or 31 km (via swingbridge)

name: Cooks Cove Walkway
introduction: Walk to Cooks Cove where Captain James Cook stopped in 1769 as part of his circumnavigation of New Zealand - with information panels, a hole-in-the-wall, and a safe cove to swim in, this walk is a good option for children.

name: Boyd, Oamaru and Cascade Hut tracks
introduction: Combine these tracks for a multi-night tramp with lush beech forest, river crossings and wildlife. Several huts and road ends allow you to tailor a trip to suit.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Dawson Falls - Stratford Plateau tracks
introduction: Walk one way from Dawson Falls to Stratford Plateau or complete a circuit back to Dawson Falls.
walkDuration: 1 hr 20 min one way | 3 hr 30 min - 4 hr return
locationString: Dawson Falls area, East Egmont area,Egmont National Park

name: Dennistoun Bush Track
introduction: Walk through magnificent ancient forest on this flat, easy walk.

name: Diamond Creek Track
introduction: The track at Diamond Creek follows the true left bank of the creek to Lake Reid.

name: Isthmus Peak Track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike this track to Isthmus Peak (1385 m) and cross the undulating skyline ridge.

name: Dome Forest car park to lookout
introduction: Starting from the Dome tearooms carpark, steps lead up along a narrow road reserve to the Dome Forest conservation area.

name: Donnelly Flat Loop Walk
introduction: The track to Donnelly Flat passes through some of the best mixed podocarp/broadleaf forest in the Tararua Range - this short, easy walk with a picnic area and stream on route is an great option for kids.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Dome Forest car park to Waiwhiu Grove
introduction: From the Dome Forest lookout the track continues to the Dome Summit where you get views of Taranga Island.

name: Earnscleugh Tailings Track
introduction: The tailings on this walk are nationally significant as the only complete record of dredging activity from 1863 to 1963. They're an awe inspiring sight, hundreds of metres wide like a giant’s ploughed field.

name: Five Mile Bay and Awaroa Tracks
introduction: These family friendly tracks stretch along the expanse of Five Mile Bay, and are great for either walking or biking.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Five Mile Loop Track
introduction: This easy track passes through superb groves of mature hard beech in the lower reaches of Graces Stream.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Fantail Bay Track
introduction: A tramping track leaves from the Fantail Bay campsite and leads to the bushline where you’ll find outstanding views.

name: Field Hut and Table Top
introduction: The day trip to Table Top is the classic climb to the tops of the western Tararua Range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
locationString: Ōtaki Forks area, Tararua Forest Park

name: Flagstaff Hill Track
introduction: Enjoy 360 degree views of the Bay of Islands from this important historic site - the Union Jack was first flown here in 1840, then chopped down four times up till 1845 as a symbolic gesture against British rule.

name: Four Sisters Walk
introduction: This walk is temporarily closed to protect it from kauri dieback disease.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Glentui Loop Track
introduction: This family walk starts from the pleasant Glentui picnic area.

name: Gentle Annie Track
introduction: One of the most popular day trips in the park is the climb to Mountain House Shelter along the easy grade of the Gentle Annie Track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Gibbston River Trail
introduction: The Gibbston River Trail is a walking and mountain bike track that stretches 11km from the historic Kawarau Suspension Bridge along the south bank of the Kawarau River.

name: Goat Island Walkway
introduction: This return walk traverses the coast part way to Cape Rodney. overlooking New Zealand's oldest and most popular marine reserve.
locationString: Cape Rodney-Okakari Point Marine Reserve (Goat Island)
locationArray: Cape Rodney-Okakari Point Marine Reserve (Goat Island)

name: Grahams Bush Track
introduction: Climb through native bush with views of Otago Harbour and Otago Peninsula.

name: Fanthams Peak/Panitahi and Syme Hut Track
introduction: On a clear day this tramp offers great views up the mountain and down to the Taranaki Ring Plain and the coastline.
locationString: Dawson Falls area, Egmont National Park

name: Gray's Bush Scenic Reserve walks
introduction: These walks pass through a remnant of the tall kahikatea (podocarp) forest which once covered much of the Gisborne plains - the shorter option is suitable for buggies and wheelchairs.

name: Hanging Valley Track
introduction: This steep tramping track in Deep Cove, Doubtful Sound leads up to an impressive hanging valley and views of the Huntleigh Falls and Deep Cove.
locationString: Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park

name: Fowlers Pass Track
introduction: Fowlers Pass (1296 m) connects Fowlers Hut on Tophouse Road with Stanley Vale and Lake Guyon huts in the St James Conservation Area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Grandview Mountain Track
introduction: Trampers are well rewarded for their effort from the upper sections of the greater Grandview Range with inspiring views over Lakes Hāwea and Wānaka and mountains beyond.

name: Harihari Coastal Walkway
introduction: Harihari Coastal Walkway is one of the most scenic walkways on the West Coast, with spectacular views of forest, rivers, mountains and coastline.

name: Liverpool Track
introduction: Liverpool Track is in the Matukituki Valley, an hour’s drive west from Wanaka. The track starts at Aspiring Hut which you get to on the West Matukituki Track.
walkDuration: 5 hr 30 min  - 6 hr 30 min one way
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Hauturu Highpoint Track
introduction: Climb onto a razor back ridge in the Waima Ranges for sensational views and pristine vegetation.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Harwoods Hole Track
introduction: At the end of Harwoods Hole Track is Harwoods Hole, the deepest vertical shaft in New Zealand. Find out how to get there and important safety information.
locationString: Abel Tasman National Park, Canaan Downs Scenic Reserve

name: Harts Creek Track
introduction: This walkway to a bird hide, where you can easily view birdlife, is a great walk for children and families.
locationString: Christchurch area, Lake Ellesmere (Te Waihora) area

name: Hideaway Hut Route
introduction: This little gem of a hut is tucked away in Ahuriri Conservation Park.

name: Hokitika Gorge Walk
introduction: Enjoy excellent views of the blue-green waters of the Hokitika River as it makes its way through the rock sided Hokitika Gorge - this short, easy walk is a great option for kids.

name: Holdsworth - Kaitoke Track
introduction: Follows the Waiohine and Tauherenikau Rivers for 36 km between Holdsworth and Kaitoke. A good introductory track for people new to the Tararuas.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Karangahake Gorge Historic Walkway
introduction: Situated at the base of the Coromandel Range, the Karangahake Gorge Historic Walkway follows the old railway line between Paeroa and Waihi, giving access to impressive remains from the mining and railway eras.
locationString: Kaimai Mamaku Conservation Park, Karangahake Gorge

name: Hook Bush Route
introduction: Enjoy expansive views out across the Canterbury Plain along an marked route up into The Hunters Hills.

name: Karangahake Windows Walk
introduction: This short walk boasts beautiful scenery and spectacular mining remnants including disused gold mining tunnels - kids will love it!
locationString: Kaimai Mamaku Conservation Park, Karangahake Gorge

name: Iron Gate Hut Track
introduction: Iron Gate Hut is a good day's hike along a sidle track up the Oroua River valley. Longer tramps are possible from this hut. Stay a night and return the same way.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Invincible Gold Mine Track
introduction: Built by miners in the 1880s, the Invincible Gold Mine Track is an uphill walk that offers wonderful views of the Rees Valley and Mt Earnslaw/Pikirakatahi.

name: Hongi Hika Walk
introduction: This short, easy walk passes through regenerating native forest to Kororipo pā - it's a great option for children to explore the heritage of early Maori/European settlement.

name: Kahikatea Walk
introduction: This easy walk is a great introduction to broadleaved forest suitable for young and old.

name: Kaharoa Kōkako Track
introduction: Walk through beautiful forest to Onaia Stream, a tranquil and secluded spot that's ideal for a picnic or to cool off in - with geocaches as well this short walk has plenty to keep kids interested.

name: Jacks Blowhole Track
introduction: Walk to a spectacular blowhole with exploding waves and roaring sound effects.

name: Jack's Point Track
introduction: A walk with superb lake and mountain views over undulating open grassland and scattered scrub, ending at Jack's Point.

name: Kahikatea Walk
introduction: Walk through recovering wetland and remnant of flooded forest on this short, easy loop walk - a good option for kids.

name: Kai Iwi Lakes Coastal Track
introduction: Walk across farmland to the expansive Ripiro Beach.
distance: 2 km one way | 8.2 km one way
walkDuration: 30 min one way | 2 hr one way

name: Kaihoka Lakes Walk
introduction: This 10 minute walk begins beside one lake and heads gently down to the other.

name: Kaitake Range walking tracks
introduction: The Kaitake Range is remarkably different from the rest of Egmont National Park with its variety of warmth-loving semi-coastal forest.

name: Kaitoke Hot Springs Track to Mt Hobson (Hirakimata)
introduction: Kaitoke Hot Springs Track is a popular easy walk following the edge of the Kaitoke Swamp to sulphurous hot springs. Continue on the Peach Tree Track to Mt Hobson (Hirakimata).
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Kamahi Loop Track
introduction: Discover 'goblin forest' on this short walk.
locationString: East Egmont area, Egmont National Park

name: Kapakapanui Track
introduction: The open summit of Kapakapanui is one of the best viewpoints in the Tararua Range.

name: Kaniere Water Race Walkway
introduction:
The Kaniere Water Race Walkway provides an opportunity for
a pleasant bush walk in an area that is rich in history.

name: Lake Emma to Lake Camp Track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike to an old musterers hut near Lake Emma.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Kawatiri Historic Railway Walk
introduction: This easy walk follows a short section of the former railway line that ran from Nelson towards Murchison.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Kepler Track: Carpark to Luxmore Hut
introduction: This is an excellent full day walk on the Kepler Track (a Great Walk) or overnight tramp to challenge young teenagers - it has swimming beaches, limestone cliffs and glorious mountain and lake views.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Karakariki Track
introduction: With suspension bridges, a stream, a waterfall and a nice spot for a picnic, this track has plenty to keep kids entertained.

name: Knights-Shorts Loop Track
introduction: Take a strenuous day hike and enjoy the spectacular scenery from the tops of the Ngamoko Range in the Ruahine Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Kerikeri River Track
introduction: Follow the bank of the Kerikeri River through regenerating forest and discover the remains of an historic power house, and Wharepuke and Rainbow Falls - it's a great option for walking children.

name: Mangahao Makahika Track
introduction: The Mangahao Makahika Track connects Burtton's Track, which lies between Palmerston North and Shannon, with the Arapaepae Lookout Trail near Levin.
walkDuration: 6 - 7 hrs going south, 7- 8 hrs going north

name: Catlins River-Wisp Loop Track
introduction: An attractive, forest-lined river walk of three sections that has several natural features and access to good fishing.
walkDuration: One long or two shorter days

name: Lake Clearwater tracks
introduction: Enjoy views of Lake Clearwater from the lake shore or the nearby Mount Guy (1319 m).

name: Kashmir Road tramping tracks
introduction: Kashmir Road climbs far and high into Ruahine Forest Park and provides quick access to the high country. Daphne Hut, Awatere Hut and Longview Hut are all accessible by a track from the road.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lake Chalice Hut tracks
introduction: Explore the area around Lake Chalice, the only lake in Mount Richmond Forest Park - the short, easy walk to the hut is ideal for an overnight tramp with children.
distance: 2.6 km to hut | 6.5 km loop from hut
walkDuration: 1 hr to hut | 2 hr 30 min loop from hut
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Lake Gunn Nature Walk
introduction: Experience wild Fiordland on one of our best short walks - wander through red beech forest, enjoying glimpses of the birdlife of the Eglinton valley, Lake Gunn and the surrounding mountains. It's a good option for children.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Lake Hauroko Lookout Track
introduction: This steep tramping track climbs from the edge of Lake Hauroko to a lookout with great views over the lake and nearby mountain ranges.

name: Lake Heron tracks
introduction: Explore the area around Lake Heron on these tracks - discover kettle holes, and views of the lake and surrounding mountains.
walkDuration: 10 min | 45 min | 1 hr | 3 hr one way

name: Lake Marian Falls Track
introduction: Discover the spectacular Marian Falls on this easy, short walking track from Hollyford Road, off Milford Road.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Lake Hayes Walkway
introduction: Stroll, walk, run or cycle around a lake surrounded by spectacular mountains.

name: Lake Marian Track
introduction: Enjoy this tramping track from Hollyford Road (off Milford Road) to beautiful Lake Marian - an alpine lake in a beautiful hanging valley.
walkDuration: 20 min return to falls, 3 hr return to lake
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Lake Matheson / Te Ara Kairaumati Walk
introduction: A gentle walk leads to views of the mountains reflected on the still waters of Lake Matheson. It's one of our best short walks.
locationString: Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Lake Rotoroa walking tracks
introduction: Waterfalls, lakeside picnics and the tree fuschia await on the walking tracks of Lake Rotoroa in Nelson Lakes National Park.

name: Eastern Okataina Walkway
introduction: Enjoy splendid lake views through native bush with the option to branch off the track and head down to Lake Okataina at several bays.

name: Lake Roxburgh Walkway
introduction: This historic trail follows an old bridle path that transported coal to the gold mining dredges 1890s-1930s.

name: Lake Waikareiti Walk
introduction: The Lake Waikareiti Walk will take you two hours to complete a return trip. Along the way you may hear the screech of the kaka and the chatty ki-ki-ki of the yellow-crowned parakeet (kakariki).

name: Lake Ohia Gumholes Reserve Walk
introduction: This short easy walk takes you through manuka scrub passing a series of excavated gumholes. A historical outing suitable for families.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lighthouse Walk
introduction: Explore Castlepoint Scenic Reserve by following the boardwalk over the reef and past the lighthouse.

name: Lewis Tops Track
introduction: Climb to the open tops with superb views and picturesque tarns.

name: Little Manganuku Track
introduction: This track starts from a historic 'Howe truss' bridge and has excellent waterfall and forest views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Londonderry Rock Walk
introduction: View the very large Londonderry Rock - which during the Kumara Goldrushes was too large for miners to move or break.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Leyland O'Brien Tramline Track
introduction: Explore the old Leyland O’Brien tramline besides the headwaters of the Ngamuwahine River.
distance: 6.3 km to junction with North-South Track

name: Leslie-Karamea Track
introduction: The Leslie–Karamea Track is one of the region’s premier semi-wilderness experiences, situated in the middle of Kahurangi National Park.

name: Little Mt Peel/Huatekerekere tracks
introduction: Climb one of the most popular peaks in Canterbury for magnificent views to Mt Somers, Mt Hutt and across the plains to the coast.

name: Lake Waikaremoana
introduction: Be welcomed into the homeland of the Tūhoe people. Trace the shoreline of Lake Waikaremoana, the ‘sea of rippling waters’, through giant podocarp rainforest, remote beaches and rugged mountains with stunning views.

name: Lotkow Road to Little's Clearing
introduction: Lotkow Road branches off Whittle Road at the entry point to the Kaweka Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Long Beach Walk
introduction: Visit Long Beach on this family and dog friendly walk and have a picnic at the reserve.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Mahoenui Track
introduction: Walk alongside the Awakino River to Leitch's Hut.

name: Manawatu Gorge Track
introduction: Walk through native bush, enjoy scenic views and experience native wildlife only a short distance from Palmerston North.

name: Mangaone Caves Track
introduction: First-time cavers including children can explore Mangaone Caves - enjoy karst type features, stalactites, stalagmites and calcite wall coverings.

name: Mangaone Walkway
introduction: Mangaone Walkway follows an old bush tramway in low hill country east of Waikanae. It was historically known as Reikorangi Track.

name: Mangleton Road to Park's Peak Ridge
introduction: It’s a 2-3 hour walk from Mangleton Road to Park’s Peak Ridge. The track links to Ruahine Range and Golden Crown Ridge to the north and Park's Peak and Upper Makaroro huts to the south.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Mahinepua Peninsula Track
introduction: The track travels the length of the peninsula, mainly along the ridgetop, giving access to the many sheltered bays and providing outstanding coastal views.

name: Manginangina Kauri Walk
introduction: Kids of all ages will be in awe of the towering kauri trees on this easy, short walk - the boardwalk allows for buggies.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Maratoto - Golden Cross Track
introduction: The track from Maratoto to Golden Cross takes you past an old mining area and a regenerating broadleaf/hardwood forest.

name: Mangakawa Track
introduction: Follow the Mangakawa Stream with views of waterfalls and small gorges.

name: Masters Shelter to Golden Crown Ridge
introduction: The Golden Crown Ridge Track begins behind Master Shelter. The 2-3 hour walk climbs around a series of rocky knolls before continuing steeply upwards through beech forest to the top of the range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Mapoutahi Track
introduction: Walk to Mapoutahi Pā along a sandy beach in Purakaunui Bay.

name: Mapara Track
introduction: You can hear and sometimes see kōkako and other birds on the Mapara Track.

name: Matai Falls Walk
introduction: Walk to the Matai Falls (10 m) through regenerating podocarp and broadleaf forest.

name: Melina Ridge Track
introduction: This is a classic mountain bike ride lower Ahuriri valley.
locationString: Hāwea Conservation Park, Lindis Conservation Area

name: Matietie Walk
introduction: This coastal walk takes you through the Matietie Historic Reserve.

name: Matamataharakeke Track
introduction: Part of the original Waikawau to Kennedy Bay route used by gold miners and loggers. It goes up the main ridge past a series of lookouts giving views over bush covered hills to coast and islands.

name: Mid Pohangina Hut Track
introduction: Cross private farmland by prior arrangement only. Once in the Ruahine Forest Park, sidle high above the picturesque Pohangina River before crossing the river and heading to the hut.

name: Mokoroa Falls Track
introduction: Walk the Mokoroa Falls Track to view the falls from a lookout platform. The track can be walked as part of a loop track when joined with the Mokoroa Stream Track and Goldie Bush Walkway.

name: Matiu/Somes Island Loop Track
introduction: A loop track around Matiu/Somes Island offers 360 degree views of Wellington harbour - with native wildlife, remnants from the world wars, historic quarantine buildings, and a lighthouse, there is plenty to keep kids interested.

name: Minnehaha Walk
introduction: This delightful short walk follows a stream through the rainforest - it's a great introduction to the forest for children with the added bonus of glow worms at night. It's suitable for wheelchairs and buggies.
locationString: Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Mingha - Deception Route
introduction: This route is a classic traverse of the Southern Alps, crossing over Goat Pass.

name: Morepork Track
introduction: Follow an old logging road over inland ridges through the Kaiikanui Forest.

name: Moraine Walk
introduction: Explore old moraine surfaces on this easy, short walk, south of Fox Glacier township.
locationString: Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Mokoroa Stream Track
introduction: The Mokoroa Stream Track is a challenging loop walk which comes off the Goldie Bush Walkway.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Motukawanui Island Track
introduction: Enjoy outstanding views of Mahinepua Peninsula, Matauri Bay and other forested islands of the Cavalli group from this walk along the ridge tops.

name: Motukiore Island Walk
introduction: This pleasant and easy walk takes you around the coastline across a causeway to Motukiore Island, and is a great summer family outing.

name: Moraine Creek Route
introduction: This challenging tramping route leads up the Moraine Creek from the Hollyford Road to beautiful Lake Adelaide in an impressive glacial basin.
walkDuration: 7-9 hr to lake, 9-11 hr to bivvy rock
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Mount Arthur summit
introduction: Climb to the top of Mt Arthur (1795 m) for panoramic views.
walkDuration: 3 hr 30 min - 4 hr 30 min one way
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: Motuarohia (Roberton) Island Track
introduction: Climb to the centre of the island for spectacular 360-degree views of the surrounding Bay of Islands.

name: Mohi Bush Scenic Reserve walks
introduction: Explore Mohi Bush and see if you can spot the tiny rifleman, New Zealand's smallest bird. This is one of the few places it is found outside of forest parks in Hawke's Bay.
locationString: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves
locationArray: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves

name: Motuoapa Cliff Lookout Walk
introduction: An easy short walk to a lookout point with panoramic views over the southern end of Lake Taupō.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Mirror Lakes Walk
introduction: Stroll among small lakes with lovely reflections of the Earl Mountains on this easy, short walk off Milford Road - it's great for children.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Mount Fox Route
introduction: Mount Fox Route is just 3 km south of the town of Fox Glacier. The challenging climb to the top is only suitable for experienced and properly equipped trampers.

name: Mount Stokes Track
introduction: This tramping track in Kenepuru Sound follows a ridge to the summit (1203 m), the highest point in the Sounds.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Mount Iron Track
introduction: This very popular loop walk offers excellent 360-degree views – it's close to Wanaka and suitable for all ages and abilities.

name: Mount Taranaki  Summit Track
introduction: From December to April, fit and well-equipped trampers can enjoy spectacular scenery from the summit of Mt Taranaki. From May to November, the mountain is covered in snow and ice - mountaineering experience and equipment is required.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Mount Shrimpton Track
introduction: A good, steep bush walk to the uplands of the McKerrow Range. Great views of the Makarora Valley below and the alps beyond.

name: Nancy Fladgate Track
introduction: This pleasant, easy walk is a chance for children to explore the bush and the shore.

name: Mount Hikurangi - Te Ara ki Hikurangi
introduction: Visit the sacred mountain of Ngāti Porou, the highest non-volcanic mountain in the North Island.

name: Mount Somers summit
introduction: Climb to the summit of Mount Somers for 360 degrees views.
locationString: Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area

name: Mt Matthews
introduction: Fit trampers can climb the tallest peak in the Remutaka range (941m) and the nearest to Wellington.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Mt Thomas tracks
introduction: Enjoy sweeping panoramic views of the Canterbury Plains, Banks Peninsula and the Southern Alps/Kā Tiritiri o te Moana from Mt Thomas (1023 m).

name: Mt Fishtail Route
introduction: Climb up to Mt Fishtail (1643 m) via Fishtail Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mount Sunday Track
introduction: Walk to the top of Mount Sunday for expansive views of the surrounding countryside.

name: Nature Trail
introduction: Enjoy a short walk alongside Woolshed Creek.
locationString: Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area

name: Ngamoko Track
introduction: Walk along the Ngamoko Track as it steadily climbs to the Ngamoko Range summit. You will be rewarded for your hard work by the views at the summit.

name: Ocean Beach tracks
introduction: Walk a loop track in Glory Cove Scenic Reserve on Stewart Island/Rakura.
locationString: Glory Cove Scenic Reserve, Stewart Island/Rakiura

name: No.1 Line tracks
introduction: Enjoy the views of the Pohangina Valley from the end of No.1 Line or shorter Trig Loop Track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Okere Falls Track
introduction: With viewing platforms that provide great views of magnificent  waterfalls and white water rafters making their way down the Kaituna River, as well as geocaches and glow worms at night, there is plenty to keep kids entertained on this short, easy walk.

name: Ngamuwahine Track
introduction: This track leads from the end of Ngamuwahine Road and takes you to a junction with the Leyland O'Brien Tramline Track.

name: Nelson Creek walks
introduction: Nelson Creek is an excellent spot to go walking, camping and exploring. With historic water races, tunnels, recreational gold fossicking and a number of short walks, there is plenty to do.

name: Nugget Point/Tokata walks
introduction: Enjoy dramatic coastal views from the Tokata Lighthouse and spot seals, penguins and other seabirds on these short walks.

name: North-South Track
introduction: This is a multi-day tramp using rugged, unmarked routes suitable for expert backcountry trampers only. Trampers will need to camp in addition to staying in huts.

name: Okitu Bush Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: This easy track through native bush has creeks for kids to explore and a grassy picnic area close to the car park - it's a great option for families.

name: North West Circuit Stewart Island/Rakiura
introduction: The North West Circuit offers challenging multi-day tramping around Rakiura/Stewart island’s northern coast.

name: Oromahoe Traverse
introduction: This track follows a ridgeline through regenerating hardwood/podocarp forest, linking Oromahoe Road with School Road, near Paihia.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Opepe walks
introduction: Perfect for families and just a short drive from Taupō on SH5, explore native bush and discover local history in this scenic and historic reserve.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Papa Aroha Walk
introduction: Walk through coastal forest to an attractive beach.

name: Ōtamahua/Quail Island tracks
introduction: Explore historic sites such as the ships' graveyard and the quarantine barracks, as well as swimming and waterskiing beaches and a bird-watching barricade. The easy grade makes these walks suitable for small children and family groups.
walkDuration: 2 hr 30 min for complete island circuit
locationString: Christchurch area, Ōtamahua/Quail Island Recreation Reserve

name: Orokonui lagoon walk
introduction: Walk around the Orokonui lagoon through native bush and view the natural wetland providing habitat for native fish and foraging birds.

name: Papaitonga Scenic Reserve walks
introduction: Take a short, easy walk around a dune lake with some great spots to enjoy views and look for/listen to birds - it's a good option for kids.

name: Opera Point Walk
introduction: Opera Point on the Coromandel Peninsula offers a walk on an old tramway line to a pleasant beach.

name: Ōrongorongo Track
introduction: This popular, easy walk passes through different forest types and has swimming holes at the end of the track - it's ideal for families.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Onepoto Caves Track
introduction: The 2 hour return walk to Onepoto Caves branches off to various caves in the area. The track then descends into a small valley where you’ll find the largest number of caves on the walk.

name: Parata Tramping Track
introduction: The Parata Tramping Track is an easier tramping track suitable for people of moderate fitness levels. It climbs to a lookout offering views of the coast and Reikorangi Valley.”

name: Opapaka Pā Walk
introduction: Walk through native forest to the site of a small defensive pā built and used by Ngati Hia in the late eighteenth century.

name: Pass Creek Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Hollyford Road up to Lake Howden on the Routeburn Track.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Pearl Harbour return via Circle Track
introduction: This tramping track takes you on a pleasant, half-day walk through beech forest near Manapouri, to a hill viewpoint overlooking the lake.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

name: Puketi Nature Trail
introduction: This is an easy wander suitable for children. The loop track leads you through a beautiful kauri forest with a chance to see glow-worms.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Quailburn Track
introduction: Tucked away under the Ohau Range lies this short track through mountain beech forest.

name: Rangitoto Island shorter walks
introduction: Take a short walk around Rangitoto Island Scenic Reserve. Stroll through a kowahi grove or glen of kidney ferns, or walk along the coast to a gull breeding colony.

name: Quartz Creek/Mount Royal Route
introduction: Climb up to the summit of Mount Royal (1366 m).
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Rawhiti Cave Track
introduction: Walk to a viewing structure at possibly the most diverse and extensive entrance and twilight-zone flora of any cave in New Zealand.

name: Pupu Hydro Walkway
introduction: Retracing an old gold-mining water race, this short walk passes through forest of young beech and rimu to mature podocarps - it's good for children but be sure to supervise them.

name: Rees-Dart Track
introduction: See spectacular mountain scenery, forest and alpine vegetation, glacier-fed rivers and the Dart Glacier on the Rees-Dart Track.

name: Ridge Track
introduction: A demanding track suitable for fit walkers. The tramp will take you 2 hours and leads between the Nikau Loop and Mangakawa tracks.

name: Riuwaka Resurgence
introduction: Walk to the cave and deep, clear pool where the Riuwaka River emerges from the depths of the Takaka Hill.

name: Remutaka Rail Trail
introduction: Built in 1878, this rail route between the Hutt Valley and Featherston is now a gently graded 18 km walk, run or mountain bike ride, with opportunities for camping, swimming and fishing.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Rokaiwhenua Stream Walk
introduction: Rokaiwhenua Stream Walk is a pleasant and easy 1-hour forest walk you get to from Tamaki Road end in Eastern Ruahine Forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Ruapekapeka Pā Track
introduction: Explore New Zealand's history on this short, easy walk - it's suitable for buggies.

name: Ryde Falls tracks
introduction: Walk to the five-tier Ryde Falls.

name: Sandfly Bay Track
introduction: Walk to Sandfly Bay and combine coastal views with wildlife viewing - kids will love the sand dunes and can earn a Kiwi Guardians medal here too.

name: Sentinel Rock Lookout Track
introduction: A challenging climb to an isolated rock outcrop in the Kaimai Ranges that offers spectacular views across the valley.

name: Routeburn Track: Earland Falls Track
introduction: This is a fabulous, easy day walk on the Routeburn Track (a Great Walk), leading to the beautiful Earland Falls with plenty of mountain and valley views along the way.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Sentinel Rock Walk
introduction: Enjoy impressive views of the glacier, the valley and Waiho River from the summit of this short steady climb.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Shirt Tail Track
introduction: A track climbing through beech forest following the Shirt Tail Stream in Kingston.

name: Seven Mile Track/Wilson Bay Track
introduction: Walk or bike through regenerating bush and pine forest with views of Wilson Bay.

name: Smugglers Bay Loop Track
introduction: With coastal forest, spectacular views and WWII gun emplacements as well - there is plenty to keep kids interested on this short, easy walk.
locationString: Bream Head Scenic Reserve, Whangārei Heads area

name: St Paul's Rock Track
introduction: This track climbs up to St Paul's Rock, which stands high above Whangaroa township and provides spectacular views of the Whangaroa Harbour. It's suitable for those with moderate fitness.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Six Foot Track
introduction: This is an easy walk to Framptons Hut and on to the Waima Main Range Track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Sugarloaf/Rockburn Track
introduction: This marked track traverses moraine through beech forest from Lake Sylvan.

name: Taheke Waterfall Track
introduction: This lovely 3-km loop track leads through a grove of regenerating kauri and offers views of the Taheke Waterfall.

name: Tahunatara Point Walk
introduction: An easy walk, ideal for families, in beautiful Whakaipo Bay. Take a picnic and spend the day on the beach.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Taieri River Track
introduction: An interesting walk in the Taieri Gorge that travels alongside the Taieri River and passes through several different types of vegetation.
locationString: Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area

name: Tarawera Outlet to Falls Track
introduction: See the Tarawera River disappearing underground at various sites before it re-emerges through the spectacular Tarawera Falls through narrow fissures in a fractured rhyolite lava cliff.

name: Tarn Hut tracks
introduction: These tracks can be combined to form a circuit walk to Tarn Hut.

name: Tarawera Falls Track
introduction: The track runs between the Waterfall road carpark to the spectacular falls, where water surges out of fissures in a high cliff face.

name: Te Hapua Bay Track
introduction: Located on the western shore of Lake Taupō, this track allows walking access to one of the most stunning bays on the lake.

name: Tauranga Loop Track
introduction: This walking track crosses the historic Tauranga Bridge and passes alongside the Tauranga Stream.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Ara a Waiau Walkway/Cycleway
introduction: Walk or cycle through bush from Franz Josef township to the Franz Josef Glacier car park.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Te Matua Ngahere Walk
introduction: View the second largest living kauri in New Zealand, Te Matua Ngahere - it's a good option for kids.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Te Waiti Nature Trail
introduction: An ideal family walk through nikau and tawa forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Puia Hut Track  and Mangatainoka Hot Springs
introduction: Walk to Te Puia Hut for an easy overnight tramp, or continue on to hot springs surrounded by bush and with river views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Weheka Walkway/Cycleway
introduction: Walk or cycle through bush from Fox Glacier township to a viewpoint of the largest active landslide in New Zealand.
locationString: Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Terrace Walk
introduction: The walk provides a good introduction to the rainforest of the Glacier Region as well and an opportunity to see glow worms after dark - it's a great option with children.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Tokaanu Thermal Walk
introduction: See steaming hot mineral pools and spluttering mud pools on this short, easy walk - it's a good option for children but be sure to supervise them.

name: Tokatea Lookout Walking Track
introduction: A short, steep track from the summit of Kennedy Bay Road, Coromandel Peninsula, leads to the Tokatea Lookout.

name: The Chasm Walk
introduction: Dramatic views of powerful waterfalls and water-sculpted shapes in the rocks will keep kids interested on this short, easy walk.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Tongariro River Trail
introduction: Follow the banks of the Tongariro River alongside farmland and through native bush and urban areas, and enjoy magnificent river views - it's an easy, mainly flat track with multiple entry points so a great option for children.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Tohumoana Lookout Track
introduction: This bush walk at Mimiwhangata offers superb views of Mimiwhangata, the coast and the Poor Knights Islands.

name: Tree Trunk Gorge tracks
introduction: Walk or mountain bike through the Kaimanawa Forest Park taking in two spectacular gorges, and the characteristic beech and kamahi forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Travers-Sabine Circuit
introduction: Experience tranquil beech forests, fields of waving tussocks, 2000‑m‑high mountains and clear rushing streams in the heart of the mountains of Nelson Lakes National Park.

name: Twelve Mile Delta to Bob’s Cove Track
introduction: Follow the shore of Lake Wakatipu and enjoy lake views, native bush and ancient marine sediments. Twelve Mile Delta was a location for Lord of the Rings' Ithilien Camp.

name: Te Reinga Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: This short track takes you to lookout with views of the spectacular Te Reinga Falls.

name: Veronica Loop Track
introduction: This is pleasant walk uphill through changing alpine rainforest, with an optional detour to a lookout point offering views of the mountain and out to the coast.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Visitor Centre to Kepler Track Carpark Walk
introduction: This is an easy walking track along Te Anau lake edge to the start of the Kepler Track, with picnic, swimming and photo spots.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Visitor Centre to Te Anau Bird Sanctuary Walk
introduction: Enjoy an easy walk along the lakeside in Te Anau that takes you to the bird sanctuary where you can see the rare, flightless takahē, kākā and other birds.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Waiatiu Falls Track
introduction: A 1 hour 30 minutes return walk, the Waiatiu Falls Track in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tāne Conservation Park leads through podocarp forest before reaching the picturesque falls.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Waiotemarama Waterfall Walk
introduction: Walk to the beautiful Waiotemarama Waterfall which cascades 20m down through the pristine rainforest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Tweedies Gully Walk
introduction: Walk from Gore Bay through a scenic reserve to a lookout with views of Pegasus Bay.

name: Waimamaku Coastal Track
introduction: Discover wide open beaches and rocky headlands on the rugged coastline between the Hokianga Harbour and the majestic Waimamaku River.

name: Tutukaka Head tracks
introduction: This short, easy walk leads to the coast and a lighthouse - it's a great option for kids.

name: Wairepo Kettleholes Track
introduction: Wairepo Kettleholes provide a feeding area for both native and introduced birds.
locationString: Omarama area, Wairepo Kettleholes Conservation Area

name: Waipakihi River tracks
introduction: Head up the Waipakihi River Valley, a popular option for hunters to access the tops, or a great day out for swimming in the summer.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Wairēinga/Bridal Veil Falls
introduction: Walk to the top and down to the base of these spectacular 55 m falls. The track is to the top of the falls is suitable for wheelchairs and buggies.

name: Wairere Falls Track
introduction: Wairere Falls Track weaves its way through moss covered rocks and tree roots. Large round boulders form natural pools and cascading waterfalls.

name: Waitanguru Falls Walk
introduction: Enjoy a short walk to a magnificant tiered waterfall.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Waitangitaona Wetland Walk
introduction: The Waitangitaona Wetland Walk is an easy walk through a regenerating kahikatea forest and flax wetland to a viewing platform with spectacular views of the Southern Alps, Kā Tiritiri o te Moana.

name: Waipapa River Track
introduction: The Waipapa River Track is a scenic two-day tramp that follows the Waipapa River through the heart of Puketi Forest. The tramp is only recommended for experienced and well-equipped trampers.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Waitonga Falls Track
introduction: The 39 m Waitonga Falls is Tongariro National Park’s highest waterfall. The well-formed track passes through mountain beech and kaikawaka forest.

name: Waituna Lagoon tracks
introduction: You can stroll the boardwalk, walk the loop track through wetland tarns or walk along the spectacular white quartz beach to the outlet of Waituna Lagoon. Waituna is a Ramsar site so is internationally recognised place of importance for birdlife.

name: Waitawheta Tramway
introduction: Follow an old tramline (1898 - 1928) on a relatively flat track through the spectacular Waitawheta Gorge - with interpretation panels as well, it's a great option for kids.

name: Wakarara Road tramping tracks
introduction: Wakarara Road tramping tracks include tracks to Poutaki Hut, Parks Peak Hut and Sparrowhawk Bivouac and the Colenso Spur to the Main Range track.

name: West Egmont tramping tracks
introduction: The western slopes of the mountain are known for their very high rainfall, resulting in numerous wet and boggy areas.

name: Whinray Scenic Reserve Track
introduction: View the spectacular Motu Falls from the car park and picnic area, or walk along an old coach road through native forest - suitable for all ages.

name: Whakapapaiti Valley Track
introduction: Winding through stunted beech forest, the Whakapapaiti Valley Track makes its way to the Whakapapaiti Hut. From here you can continue in a loop back to Whakapapa Village.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Whangaruru North Head walking tracks
introduction: The Whangaruru North Head Walking Tracks start from the popular Puriri Bay Campsite. The tracks follow through native forest and ridgelines before dropping down into secluded bays.

name: White Pine Bush Scenic Reserve walks
introduction: Experience New Zealand's remaining coastal forest on these short, easy walks that are good for children.

name: White Pine Bush Track
introduction: A 250 metre wheelchair accessible walkway has been built into the heart of White Pine Bush Scenic Reserve.

name: Wharfedale Hut tracks
introduction: Walk or mountain bike to Wharfedale Hut.

name: Whitecliffs Walkway
introduction: This walkway uses the Kapuni to Auckland gas pipeline route for a considerable distance.  The laying of the pipeline opened up walking access to the dramatic forest and coastal country of the region.
locationString: White Cliffs and Mount Messenger Conservation Area
locationArray: White Cliffs and Mount Messenger Conservation Area

name: Whitianga Rock Walk
introduction: A short walking track from Ferry Landing Wharf leads into Whitianga Rock Scenic and Historic Reserve where you can visit the remains of a pa site.

name: Wooded Gully loop walks
introduction: There are numerous options, some suitable for children, for a loop walk from Wooded Gully picnic area.

name: Otaika Valley Walk
introduction: The Otaika Valley Walk offers you a variety of landscapes including farmland and native forest.
distance: 2.5 km to reserve boundary, 4.5 km to Raumanga
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Woods Creek Track
introduction: This fascinating forest track passes by tailraces and dams and through tunnels built by gold miners in the 19th century.

name: Zekes Hut Track
introduction: An ideal day hike or easy overnight tramp to a newly replaced hut nestled within Hihitahi Forest Sanctuary north of Taihape.
walkDuration: 2 hr 30 min - 3 hr 30 min one way

name: Devils Punchbowl Walking Track
introduction: Feel the full force and sound of fresh mountain water falling 131 m down one of New Zealand’s most stunning waterfalls. It's one of our best short walks.

name: Waterworks Walk
introduction: Pass through attractive native bush, alongside a stream, to an old dam - it's ideal for children.

name: Te Haua Uru Track
introduction: The Te Haua Uru Track is the Tangihua Forest and links with the Horokaka Track and Tangihua Main Ridge Track to form a loop that will take experienced trampers 9 hours to complete.
walkDuration: 3 hr 45 min to junction one way from car park
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Rimu Walk
introduction: This short loop walk from Kakaho Campsite takes in the fantastic views and the tall trees of the Pureora Forest.

name: Waihora Lagoon Walk
introduction: This short walk leads to a viewing platform over a lagoon, where tall trees are reflected in the water.

name: Ōtepatotu Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: This loop track reaches the summit of Lavericks Peak with a 'goblin forest' on the way - trees hung with weeping moss.

name: Denniston Bridle Path
introduction: The bridle path, completed in 1884, makes a pleasant if steep bush walk.

name: Okuti Valley Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: You can picnic at Okuti Valley Scenic Reserve which features lowland forest such as kaikahikatea, tōtara, māhoe and kānuka.

name: Pigeon Bay Walkway
introduction: This walkway follows the eastern side of Pigeon bay out to the head of the bay and has spectacular coastal views.

name: Peters Pool Walk
introduction: Enjoy the reflective views of the glacier valley and mountains on this short, easy walk to a small kettle lake - it's a great option with children.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Red Tarns Track
introduction: Walk to tarns with red pond weed and enjoy panoramic views of the surrounding area.

name: Tama Lakes Track
introduction: Enjoy views of two lakes that occupy old explosion craters on Tama Saddle between Ruapehu and Ngauruhoe.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Cave Creek/Kotihotiho Track
introduction: Walk down to the deep, narrow chasm of Cave Creek and be surrounded by moss-covered rocks and overhanging trees.

name: Sealy Tarns Track
introduction: Climb the 'stairway to heaven' to Sealy Tarns, and enjoy spectacular views and alpine flowers.

name: Moria Gate and Mirror Tarn Loop
introduction: Enjoy a beautiful limestone arch and spectacular rainforest reflections on a short walk that kids will love.

name: Whakapapa Village short walks
introduction: These short walks are either accessible on foot from Whakapapa Village or require a short drive to the start of the track.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Soda Springs Walk
introduction: Walk to cold water springs that create a small oasis of flowers in summer.

name: Oparara Arch
introduction: Walk to a magnificant limestone arch - it's easy, interesting and great for kids.

name: Fenian walks and tracks
introduction: Explore the three Fenian Caves or the Fenian Workings.

name: Mangaoraka Loop Track
introduction: Pass through lowland forest on this short loop walk on the road up to North Egmont.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: The Old Ghost Road
introduction: This old gold miners' road is being revived as a tramping and mountain biking track. It traverses native forests, tussock tops, river flats and valleys with stunning views of the magnificent Mōkihinui Gorge and surrounds.

name: Goldsborough (Shamrock) Track
introduction: Walk through an historic gold mining area with mining tunnels, dams, sluice faces, tailings and water-races.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Lake Brunner (Moana) (north) walks
introduction: Explore the area around Moana township and Arnold River, and enjoy lake and river views.

name: Southern Access Corridor
introduction: This route, bordering New Zealand Defence Force land, heads from the Desert Road through to the Otamateanui Stream and Rangitikei River confluence.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Carrick Range access tracks
introduction: Rising above Bannockburn and rich in goldmining history, the Carrick Range is one of the most accessible mountain ranges in Central Otago. These tracks take you to three conservation areas and two historic reserves.
distance: Various up to 12 km one way
walkDuration: Various up to 5 hr one way

name: Tupapakurua Falls Track
introduction: Walk to a lookout point with views of Mt Taranaki and Mt Ruapehu, then on to the remote Tupapakurua Falls.

name: Aongatete walks
introduction: Walks at Aongatete take you through pūriri and kohekohe forest and along the Aongatete Stream.

name: Surat Bay Beach Walk
introduction: This short walk goes through sand dunes and is the only access to Surat Beach when it is high tide.

name: Rocky Lookout
introduction: Walk up to a viewing platform for extensive views of the surrounding area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Mount Robertson tramping tracks
introduction: Mountain bike or walk through mature and regenerating forest , with the option to visit the Mt Robertson/Tokomaru summit.

name: Paparoa Track and Pike29 Memorial Track
introduction: Paparoa Track crosses the Paparoa Range. It takes you through alpine tops, limestone karst landscapes and thriving rainforests, and provides breath-taking views.

name: Bob’s Camp Bivouac Route
introduction: Visit a cute bivvy with an unusual curved roof.

name: Bob’s Cove Bridle Track
introduction: On Bob's Cove Bridle Track you'll follow history along the original bridle track that linked Queenstown and Glenorchy.

name: Antimony Mines Track
introduction: The Antimony Mines Track which leads from Endeavour Inlet past the site of an old mine and on to the Titirangi Road.

name: Aorere Goldfields Track
introduction: Aorere Goldfields Track is a 3-hour loop, which gives you access to explore some of the more accessible gold-mining remnants.

name: Ananui Falls Track
introduction: This track has been closed to prevent the spread of kauri dieback.

name: Anaura Bay Walkway
introduction: This track passes through coastal forest, pine-clad valleys and dense native bush - with a fairly easy grade it's suitable for children, although some climbing is required and there are a few steep places.

name: Anatoki and Historic Kill Devil Pack Tracks
introduction: Explore beautiful beech forest, dramatic gorge scenery and rock debris dam at Lake Stanley. Trampers can also enjoy a historic hut experience in restored character huts from 1930s gold mining days.

name: Rotopounamu Track
introduction: This track circles a beautiful lake surrounded by native forest and is a special favourite of tree lovers, birdwatchers, and families.

name: Rough Creek Track
introduction: This track leads to Lake Christabel.

name: Rotoma Bridle Track
introduction: Walk through a magnificant stand of native bush.
locationString: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves
locationArray: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves

name: Bruce Park Loop Track
introduction: An easy walk through a podocarp and broadleaf forest remnant with impressive specimens of rimu, totara and kahikatea - great for kids and they can earn a Kiwi Guardians medal too!

name: Burnt Ridge Track
introduction: This tramping track offers an easy walk from the Borland Lodge grounds to Lake Monowai, in Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Round the Mountain Track
introduction: The Round the Mountain Track showcases the varied volcanic landscapes and alpine vegetation on the flanks of the active volcano Mount Ruapehu. It's a more remote alternative to the Tongariro Northern Circuit Great Walk.

name: Burrill Route
introduction: Burrill Route was formed in the 1970s by miners prospecting for copper.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Brunner Mine Site Walk
introduction: Explore the fascinating and family-friendly historic Brunner Mine and enjoy the interactive displays.
locationString: Brunner Mine historic area, Greymouth area

name: Burtton's Track
introduction: Burtton's Track (Scotts Road to Mangahao Road) lies between Palmerston North and Shannon.
walkDuration: 6 hr going south, 7 hr going north

name: Canyon Creek Track
introduction: Discover spectacular waterfalls and a rock bivvy in the Canyon Creek area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Mangorewa Track
introduction: This track passes through a fine example of lowland forest, one of the few areas left unlogged on the Mamaku Plateau.

name: Cape Brett Track
introduction: The Cape Brett Track traverses rugged terrain for 16 km through native and regenerating bush. Expect dramatic coastal views; steep cliffs and drop-offs to the side of the track are a feature.

name: Cathedral Caves Walk
introduction: Walk through bush and along the beach to explore the impressive Cathedral Caves.

name: Cathedral Cove Walk
introduction: Stunning views of the Coromandel coast guide you to the dramatic cliffs and iconic rock archway of Cathedral Cove. This is one of best short walks.

name: Chalkies Track
introduction: Climb 400 m on this steep loop track which traverses Powder Hill to see spectacular views of the Silver Peaks and Saddle Hill.

name: Catchpool Loop Walk
introduction: Walk through a nikau grove and podocarp/broadleaf forest.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Coal Creek Track
introduction: Enjoy the lovely bush walk down to the impressive Coal Creek Falls. A nice place to cool off with a swim in the hot summer months.

name: Cameron Valley Track
introduction: Starting at the Cameron Creek car park enjoy a good day's tramp ending at the 4-bunk Cameron Hut.
locationString: Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Callery Gorge Walk
introduction: Follow the Callery Gorge Walk as it climbs to a high terrace before descending to the Callery River.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Cobb Ridge Route
introduction: Enjoy views of Cobb Reservoir from this track that runs along the ridge above.

name: Charming Creek Walkway
introduction: A section of Charming Creek Walkway is closed. Scenery and history combine in this walk along a historic bush tramway, with spectacular vistas up and down the Ngakawau Gorge, alongside an unfolding view of the Mangatini Falls. Located near Westport, it's one of our best short walks.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Cobb valley tracks
introduction: The Cobb valley provides options for day and overnight walks with a river and an historic hut to keep kids entertained.

name: Come in Time Battery Walk
introduction: Walk to an old mine entrance and a restored battery - there are other relics from gold mining days as well so plenty to keep kids entertained.

name: Comet Road end to Shutes Hut
introduction: From Comet Road End take a 2-3 hour walk to historic Shutes Hut, built in 1920 for rabbiters and musterers to use.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Kaweka Forest Park, Ruahine Forest Park

name: Cable Bay Walkway
introduction: Enjoy the coastal views on this walkway between Rotokura/Cable Bay and The Glen, near Nelson. Boating, sea kayaking, and snorkeling are all possible.

name: Crystal Battery Track
introduction: Retrace the miners’ daily walk from their homes in Skippers to the Crystal Mine, their workplace in the 1930s and 40s.

name: Crown Track to Dickey's Flat
introduction: Take this short walk through historic mining country through to the Dickey Flat Campsite.
locationString: Kaimai Mamaku Conservation Park, Karangahake Gorge

name: Cullen Point tracks
introduction: Walk the beautiful loop track for views of Pelorus Sound and Havelock and the short lookout track for views of Mahua Sound.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Daly's Clearing Loop Track
introduction: A highlight along this track is the extensive groves of nīkau nestled under tall tawa, kohekohe and pukatea forest.

name: Curtis Falls Track
introduction: Walk to Curtis Falls and enjoy a dip in the shallow pool beneath the falls.
locationString: East Egmont area, Egmont National Park

name: Dawson Falls short walks
introduction: Walk to the one of the world's oldest continuously operating generators or to Dawson Falls (18 m).
walkDuration: 5 min one way | 10 min one way
locationString: Dawson Falls area, Egmont National Park

name: Dome Forest car park to Govan Wilson Rd, Matakana
introduction: A challenging longer walk (7 hrs) through regenerating native forest that is also part of Te Araroa, The Long Pathway. The track starts at the Dome carpark and ends at Govan Wilson Rd, Matakana.

name: Diamond Lake and Rocky Mountain walks
introduction: Choose from several walks including short, easier options suitable for kids, and enjoy views of Diamond Lake, Lake Wānaka and the surrounding mountains.
locationString: Diamond Lake and Hospital Flat conservation areas
locationArray: Diamond Lake and Hospital Flat conservation areas

name: Deep Stream Track
introduction: Walk within a flooded canyon to a shady picnic or fishing spot near Lake Aviemore in the Waitaki Valley.
locationString: Lake Benmore and Lake Aviemore area
locationArray: Lake Benmore and Lake Aviemore area

name: Douglas Walk
introduction: This short, easy forest walk passes by a reflective lake and crosses over glacial landforms - it's suitable for children.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Dromedary Hill Track
introduction: It is well worth the effort getting out the car and stretching your legs with a day hike up Dromedary Hill.

name: Emily Falls and Rata Falls Tracks
introduction: Choose between these two waterfall walks.
distance: 1.6 km one way | 1.5 km one way
walkDuration: 45 min one way | 1 hr one way

name: Dry Creek Track
introduction: Dry Creek Track provides great backcountry opportunities for short walks, tramping and mountain biking with access to the Dry Creek and Neinei i Kura Conservation areas.
locationString: Dry Creek and Neinei i kura Conservation Areas
locationArray: Dry Creek and Neinei i kura Conservation Areas

name: Earnslaw Burn Track
introduction: Following Earnslaw Burn through bush to the tussock basin at the head of this valley for impressive views of an icefall on Mt Earnslaw/Pikirakatahi.

name: Flora Hut and Mount Arthur Hut tracks
introduction: Walk through beech forest to one of two huts, or combine the tracks for a circuit walk - a great day walk or overnight tramp for families with kids.
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: Ferndale tracks
introduction: From the Ferndale campsite there is a 15 minute loop track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Flower Brothers Walk
introduction: From Lake Rotoroa car park, this track passes through a stand of kahikatea and around the lake outlet emerging on the road near Lake Rotoroa Lodge.

name: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere Walk
introduction: Follow a rocky riverbed path, suitable for children, past a waterfall to Franz Josef Glacier viewing area.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Gertrude Saddle Route
introduction: Gertrude Saddle includes rocky alpine terrain and should only be attempted by experienced trampers and in good weather. Wet weather, snow or ice create treacherous conditions in any season.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: French Pass Lookout Track
introduction: This track takes you to a viewpoint over historic Te Aumiti/French Pass, where the tide rushes back and forth like a river.
locationString: French Pass and D'Urville Island Scenic Reserves
locationArray: French Pass and D'Urville Island Scenic Reserves

name: Gillespies Beach walking tracks
introduction: A visit to Gillespies Beach offers a scenic drive, lovely views of the Southern Alps Kā Tiritiri o te Moana, an historic cemetery and coastal walks.

name: Glacier Burn Track
introduction: At Glacier Burn you'll climb through beech forest to Glacier Basin. Follow the creek beyond to view the Humboldt Mountains.

name: Goldie Bush Walkway
introduction: Goldie Bush Scenic Reserve offers a variety of walks through coastal kauri forest, taking in the impressive Mokoroa Falls.

name: Gordon Park Loop Track
introduction: This flat and well-formed track passes through native podocarp-hardwood forest and has a variety of birds - with a picnic table at the start, it's a good option for families.

name: Gillespie Pass Circuit
introduction: This excellent circuit for experienced parties provides spectacular mountain scenery, alpine vegetation and river valleys filled with silver beech/tawhai.  The side trip to Crucible Lake is exceptional.

name: H Tree Track
introduction: The H Tree Track in Whirinaki Te Pua-a-Tāne Conservation Park is an easy loop track  through grand podocarp forest. The forest is home to a number of native birds, including kaka.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Hakarimata Rail Trail
introduction: This family walking and cycling track follows the route of the former Ngaruawahia/Glen Massey railway to attractive stream cascades.

name: Hawksbury lagoon and beach walk
introduction: Walk around Hawksbury lagoon in Waikouaiti and enjoy this wildlife refuge providing habitat for ducks and native birds which can be seen from the causeways that cross the pools.

name: Gunns Bush Track
introduction: Walk along an enchanting moss carpet.

name: Heaphy Track
introduction: Travel through expansive tussock downs, lush forests and nīkau palms to the roaring seas of the West Coast.

name: Helena Falls Track
introduction: This tramping track in Deep Cove, Doubtful Sound leads around the cove to a stream looking up to Helena Falls.
locationString: Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park

name: Henderson Tramline Loop Track
introduction: This walk follows a branch of the tramline through the bush to the North South track, and returns along a separate tramline branch back to the road.

name: Hollyford Track: Hidden Falls Track
introduction: Enjoy this easy day walk along the Hollyford Track to the beautiful Hidden Falls or the nearby hut for lunch.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area

name: Horokaka Track
introduction: Horokaka Track is a challenging track that includes strenuous climbing. The track leads up to an old logging road and then follows the ridge to the Horokaka Transmitter.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Humboldt Falls Track
introduction: This easy, well graded walking track from the Hollyford Road takes you on a short climb through rainforest to the lookout of the impressive Humboldt Falls.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area

name: Hut Creek Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Milford Road and up the Hut Creek Valley through beech forest to the river flats.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Huriawa Pā Walk
introduction: Walk around Huriawa Peninsula on a well-formed track suitable for children - take in spectacular views and read plaques with the history of the area. Kids can earn a Kiwi Guardians medal here too.

name: Huka Falls tracks
introduction: Take a scenic walk along the banks of the Waikato River, or simply explore the many lookout points at Huka Falls, one of the most visited natural attractions in New Zealand - these short, easy walks are great for kids.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Jackson Bay Okahu walks
introduction: For an easy walk head to the rocky shore where kids of all ages can explore tidal pools, or follow an old pioneer's track before continuing down the river to the coast.

name: Hollyford Track
introduction: The Hollyford Track is a fantastic 4-8 day Fiordland tramp from the mountains to the sea at Martins Bay, and can be walked all year round.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Hollyford Valley area

name: Kaikōura Peninsula Walkway
introduction: Observe seals and seabirds, explore historic pā and whaling sites and enjoy clifftop views of the sea and mountains. Suitable for families, the whole walkway takes three hours but you can also explore a range of shorter tracks.

name: Kaimai Summit Loop Track
