introduction: This easy, peaceful walking track lingers beside a small fresh water stream.

name: Kaipawa Trig Track
introduction: Walk through regenerating forest to a trig.

name: Kaimanawa Road short walks
introduction: Two family friendly short walks starting from Urchin Campsite at the end of Kaimanawa Road.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Kairakau Loop Track
introduction:
A great opportunity to walk through mature lowland
podocarp forest with excellent examples of kahikatea,
matai, miro and tōtara.
locationString: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves
locationArray: Elsthorpe and Mohi Bush Scenic Reserves

name: Kaniwhaniwha: Kahikatea tree
introduction: Walk to the tallest recorded native tree in New Zealand.

name: Karamu Walkway
introduction: Superb 360 degree views and impressive limestone bluffs are features of this walk.

name: Karikari Bay Walk
introduction: Take a quick walk to a long, white sandy beach on Northland's Karikari Peninsula.

name: Kaniwhaniwha: Nikau Walk and Kaniwhaniwha Caves
introduction: Follow a stream through beautiful native forest or walk through a 20 metre limestone cave - with swimming and picnicking opportunities as well, these tracks are great for children.

name: Kaituna Track
introduction: Beautiful native forest and gold-mining relics are the main attractions of the Kaituna Valley. To walk the whole track takes 8-9 hours, or there are shorter walks from 20 minutes to 2 hours.
walkDuration: 8-9 hr or shorter walks from 20 min to 2 hr

name: Karioi summit tracks
introduction: Karioi is an ancient volcano and the views from the summit  are spectacular.

name: Kauri Bushman's Walk
introduction: This short kauri forest walk is gentle, making it suitable for children and an easy opportunity to enjoy the unique kauri forest environment.

name: Kauri Stump Walk
introduction: This easy walk in the Omahuta Kauri Sanctuary will take you to the stump and head of one of the largest kauri ever felled in the Omahuta Forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Kauri Block Track
introduction: The Kauri Block walk on the Coromandel Peninsula follows a ridge through regenerating bush and native plantings. Be sure to walk up the side track which leads you to a pa and offers spectacular views.

name: Kauri Loop Track
introduction: This well formed track offers spectacular views, beautiful bush and one of the largest kauri trees in the Waikato.

name: Kepler Track: Carpark to Rainbow Reach
introduction: A pleasant walking track alongside the river through beech forest, along part of the Kepler Track (Great Walk) near Te Anau.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Kauri Dam Walk
introduction: This easy walk takes you through regenerating forest and by the remains of an old timber dam before coming to a viewing area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Kidds Bush Nature Walk
introduction: The Kidds Bush Nature Walk is an enjoyable loop track through a mountain beech forest.

name: Kororipo Pā Historic Walk
introduction: Walk in the footsteps of chief Hongi Hika and early missionaries to Kororipo Pā – this short, easy walk is suitable for children.

name: Lake Alta Track
introduction: Climb to the picturesque glacial Lake Alta.

name: Lake Benmore area tracks
introduction: Several enjoyable walking tracks are located near Lake Benmore in the Waitaki valley.
locationString: Lake Benmore and Lake Aviemore area
locationArray: Lake Benmore and Lake Aviemore area

name: Lake Daniell Track
introduction: This is a great walk for families with young children or those people new to tramping. The track is a well formed bench track that can also be completed as a day walk.

name: Knuckle Hill Track
introduction: From the top of Knuckle Hill are excellent views of the top of the South Island, particularly Farewell Spit and Whanganui Inlet.

name: Lake Kaitawa Fairy Springs Track
introduction: This one hour walk will lead you around Lake Kaitawa, a small lake to the south of Lake Waikaremoana. Along the way take the track to Green Lake and Fairy Springs.

name: Lake Kaniere short walks
introduction: These short forest walks lead to picnic areas, waterfalls and sandy beaches ideal for swimming - plenty to keep kids interested.

name: Kohekohe Walk
introduction: Kohekohe Walk in Hemi Matenga Memorial Park Scenic Reserve is suitable for people of all ages and fitness levels. It links Tui Crescent to Kakariki Grove.

name: Lake Pukaki area tracks
introduction: Explore the area around Lake Pukaki on these short walking tracks.
locationString: Lake Pukaki area, Ruataniwha Conservation Park

name: Lake Rere walk
introduction: A steep climb through red beech eases before reaching picturesque Lake Rere, a popular tourist destination in the late 19th century.

name: Lake Sylvan Track
introduction: This well-defined track leads through old moraine river terraces and tall red beech/tawhai raunui to pretty Lake Sylvan in Mount Aspiring National Park.

name: Lake Wombat Walk
introduction: This short, easy walk leads through a lush rimu forest to the idyllic Lake Wombat - it's a good option for children.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Langsview Track
introduction: For amazing views of the countryside and coastline, follow this track along the ridgeline of the Brynderwyn range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lake Tekapo town tracks
introduction: These tracks can be reached on foot from Lake Tekapo township.

name: Lower Wye Creek Track
introduction: This steep track follows the pipeline from the dam and leads you to the foot of a rock bluff. A further walk through beech forest takes you to the stream in the Lower Wye Creek basin.

name: Leith Saddle Track
introduction: This tramping track travels through the cloud forest above the Leith Saddle on Dunedin's Northern Motorway.

name: Macaulay Hut Track
introduction: Macaulay valley can be accessed on foot, or by mountain bike, horse or 4WD.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Leitch's Track
introduction: Take the shortest route to Leitch's clearing and Leitch's Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Maharahara Peak Track
introduction: Take a steep climb through forest to the rocky open knolls of Maharahara high point in the Ruahine Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Mahinapua short walks
introduction: These short walks pass through dense bush to reach Lake Mahinapua - with a picnic area/campsite at one end, these walks are great for kids.

name: Mahia Peninsula Scenic Reserve Track
introduction: Walk through one of the best examples of semi coastal forest on the east coast of the North Island on this loop track - it's suitable for older children.

name: Main Ridge Track
introduction: Tangihua Main Ridge is a rough track, which follows the main ridge through thick vegetation. The views from the track are very rewarding on a clear day.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Maketawa Hut Circuit
introduction: This circuit offers fantastic views of Mt Taranaki from the Maketawa Hut - it can be enjoyed as a half day tramp but is also a good overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Manganuku Track
introduction: This track follows the Manganuku Stream to the Manganuku Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mangaotaki Walk
introduction: Discover towering kahikatea on this short loop walk.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mangapohue Natural Bridge Walk
introduction: Walk through an impressive limestone gorge that passes underneath a 17 m high natural arch.

name: Mangapumarumaru Track
introduction: This strenuous 4 hour track starts in the Waioeka Gorge, 23km south of Ōpōtiki.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Lake Hāwea Track
introduction: This provides access to one of the Hāwea Conservation Park's most beautiful areas, the Hunter Valley.

name: Mangatoa Track
introduction: Crossing the beautiful Herangi Range, this alternative track leads to Leitch's Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Maitai Bay Headland Track
introduction: Pass through farmland and manuka scrubland to Maitai Bay Headlands, where you can enjoy scenic views of Waikato Bay and Maitai Bay.

name: Mangapurua/Kaiwhakauka Track
introduction: The Mangapurua and Kaiwhakauka Tracks are two stages of the Mountains to Sea Cycle Trail. The two tracks have various entry/exit options
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Matiu/Somes Island Bullock Track
introduction: Walk through forest to the centre of Matiu/Somes Island, on one of the original tracks on the island.

name: Kauaeranga Kauri Trail (Pinnacles Walk)
introduction: This popular walk leads to Pinnacles Hut, and on to the summit of the Pinnacles with spectacular views of the Coromandel Peninsula. It can be completed as a day or overnight walk.

name: Matiu/Somes Island gun emplacements track
introduction: Walk to the top of Matiu/Somes Island, to see gun emplacements built during World War II and enjoy 360 degree views.

name: McLean Falls Walk
introduction: Walk to the spectacular McLean Falls though a variety of forest and shrub types.
locationString: Catlins coastal area, Catlins Conservation Park

name: Middle Ridge Track
introduction: This walking track links up with two popular tracks within Catchpool Valley.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Milford Sound Lookout Track
introduction: Enjoy impressive views of stunning Milford Sound from a lookout on this short, easy walking track.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Mikonui Catchment - Dickie Ridge/Upper Tuke River Route
introduction: The Dickie Ridge/Tuke River Route provides a link to challenging alpine tramping opportunities and gives access to the Waitaha and Whitcombe catchments.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Moeraki Valley Track
introduction: The Moeraki Valley offers good tramping for the fit and experienced. The U-shaped valley is typical of those carved out by glaciers during repeated glacial periods.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Haast,  Paringa and Moeraki rivers area
locationArray: Haast, Paringa and Moeraki rivers area

name: Mokaihaha Track
introduction: Large podocarps and a chance to hear kaka and other native birdlife while walking along the Mokaihaha Track which takes you past Lake Rotohokahoka.

name: Mistake Creek Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track leads from the Milford Road and up the Mistake Creek Valley through beech forest to the river flats.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Motuara Island Lookout Track
introduction: Experience stunning views over Queen Charlotte Sound and spot some native birds on this walk up to the island's summit.
locationString: Motuara Island Scenic Reserve, Queen Charlotte Sound/Tōtaranui area

name: Moke Lake Loop Track
introduction: This popular short, undulating walk through grassland is surrounded by mountains and goes right round the lake.

name: Monument Track
introduction: This is a short but challenging tramping track from Hope Arm in Lake Manapouri up to the summit of The Monument, with great lake views in good weather.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

name: Monckton Walkway
introduction: Enjoy a short walk through native forest rich in kahikatea, tōtara, beech, matai, tawa and kowhai. Plenty of native birds to see as well.

name: McKinnon Hut Track
introduction: Perched on the northern end of the Hikurangi Range in Ruahine Forest Park, McKinnon Hut is accessed via a long ridge climbing up from the Kawhatau Valley. Stay a night and return the same way.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Moeraki Boulders Walk
introduction: Take a walk to the Moeraki Boulders - geological marvels, exposed by erosion of sedimentary rocks laid down from 65 to 13 million years ago.

name: Milford Foreshore Walk
introduction: Wander through beech forest and along the sandy foreshore of Milford Sound, and enjoy fabulous views of Mitre Peak - it's an easy, short walk that's great for kids.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Moturua Island Track
introduction: This track goes right around Moturua Island. You can join the track at any of the main beaches and walk through open grassy areas and along cool shady stretches beneath the regenerating coastal forest trees.

name: Brewster Track
introduction: The track starts from Fantail Falls, crosses the Haast River, and climbs steadily through beech forest to the bushline.
locationString: Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Motuora Island walks
introduction: Motuora is a small island with walks of up to two hours. Walk to the northern end of the island or to Still Bay, a perfect place for a picnic.

name: Mount Damper Falls Walk
introduction: This short walk leads to Mount Damper Falls, one of the highest falls in the North Island.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area
locationArray: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area

name: Mount Auckland Atuanui Walkway
introduction: Take a walk to the summit of Mount Auckland (Atuanui) through regenerating native forest. At the summit you’ll have panoramic views of Kaipara Harbour and Hoteo River Estuary.
distance: 3.5 km to the summit one way
walkDuration: 1 hr 45 min to the summit one way

name: Mount Messenger to Whitecliffs Walkway Track
introduction: This track climbs to the summit of Mt Messenger and then descends to the coast.
locationString: White Cliffs and Mount Messenger Conservation Area
locationArray: White Cliffs and Mount Messenger Conservation Area

name: Mount Manaia Track
introduction: A steady climb through regenerating native bush to the summit of Mount Manaia rewards you with breath-taking views of the dramatic entrance to Whangārei-Terenga-Paraoa (Whangārei Harbour).

name: Mount Damper to Te Rerepahupahu Falls track
introduction: This track to Te Rerepahupahu Falls is recommended for fit and experienced trampers only.
locationString: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area
locationArray: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area

name: Mount Barrosa Track
introduction: Climb to the top of Mount Barrosa (1364 m) for good views of the surrounding countryside.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Mount Robert Circuit
introduction:
This loop track around the northern face of Pourangahau/Mount
Robert offers spectacular views over Lake Rotoiti that will keep even kids entertained. It can be enjoyed as a day or overnight walk.

name: Mount Tuhua Track
introduction: This is a steep tramp to the open tussock peak of Mt. Tuhua (1125 m) and is suitable for fit people only.

name: Mount Tutamoe Track
introduction: Climb through Kaihu Forest to the top of Mount Tutamoe and you will be rewarded by stunning, panoramic views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Mt Ngongotaha Jubilee Track
introduction: The only walking track up to the summit of Mt Ngongotaha. Passes through native forest with views of one of the largest rata trees in the Bay of Plenty.

name: Mt Judah / Heather Jock Tracks
introduction: Scheelite mining history, open tussock country and grand views await on these tracks - with the option of staying overnight in the basic Heather Jock Hut.
walkDuration: 2 - 3 hr one way | 3 - 4 hr 30 min one way

name: Mt Nimrod Track
introduction: Walk to a cascading waterfall and enjoy gorgeous views out to the coast.

name: Mt Ngongotaha Nature Loop Track
introduction: The Loop Track is a short walk orientated towards families or school groups to provide an experience close to town showcasing the beautiful flora and fauna of Mt Ngongotaha for all to see.

name: Mt Oxford tracks
introduction: Climb to the summit of Mt Oxford (1364 m) for good views of the Canterbury Plains and into Lees Valley.

name: Mt Tamahunga Walkway
introduction: Tramp up to the summit of Mt Tamahunga through regenerating native forest. This track is part of Te Araroa - The Long Pathway.
walkDuration: 1 hr 30 min one way to summit or 3 hr 30 min one way to Rodney Rd

name: Mt Sunday/Mt Riley Track
introduction: Pass over Mt Sunday (1310 m) and Mt Riley (1314 m) on this circuit track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mt Urchin Track
introduction: Mount Urchin offers an easily accessible wilderness of beautiful beech forest, incredible views and a real alpine environment.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mt Patriarch Route
introduction: Walk or mountain bike up Mt Patriarch (1656 m).
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Muriwai Walk
introduction: Located beyond Port Jackson campsite, this stunning coastal walk leaves the Muriwai Hilltop car park and heads along a benched farm track along the ridge  towards Wharekaiatua Pa.

name: Nga Taonga Nature Walk
introduction: Learn about forest plant life from information signs on this easy walk.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: North Egmont short walks
introduction: Explore North Egmont on these short walks.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Ngutuoha Nature Trail
introduction: An easy loop trail with interpretation panels provide a 1 hour walking experience in the Waimana Valley at the north end of Te Urewera.

name: North Borland Track
introduction: This tramping track offers an excellent trip to the North Borland Hut in Monowai, Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Ngapuketurua Track
introduction: This track begins on the Kiko Loop and continues as far as the park boundary on the slopes of Mt Ngapuketurua.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Old Maori Trail
introduction: The Old Maori Trail is also know as the Rosie Bay - Lake Kaitawa Track and follows what was once a Maori trail to the lake.

name: Old Doubtful Sound Track
introduction: This tramping track follows a century-old trail in Deep Cove, Doubtful Sound, through mixed podocarp forest.
locationString: Doubtful Sound/Patea area, Fiordland National Park

name: Mueller Hut Route
introduction: At 1800 metres on the Sealy Range, Mueller Hut provides a 360-degree panorama encompassing glaciers, ice cliffs, vertical rock faces and New Zealand’s highest peaks.

name: Omaru Falls Walk
introduction: A gentle 30 min walk through bush and over farmland to the beautiful Omaru Falls. On Omaru Road, clearly signposted from SH4.

name: Opua Kauri Walk
introduction: A pleasant walk through regenerating forest to a lookout with stunning views over a valley that is home to kauri trees.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Opouri Bridle Track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike through native forest and farmland from Opouri Saddle down to Harvey Bay (Duncan Bay).
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Oruatua walks
introduction: At the mouth of the Tauranga-Taupō River in the small village of Oruatua, there are two easy walking tracks to enjoy the river, the native bush of the reserves and the expansive lake views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Otanewainuku walking tracks
introduction: Explore Otanewainuku Forest on these short walks - there's an easier option for families with children.

name: Orari Gorge Track
introduction: This circular walk passes through regenerating forest with some large tōtara, kahikatea and mataī.

name: Orokawa Scenic Reserve short walking tracks
introduction: Take one of the short walks in the reserve or combine for a longer coastal walk. Get spectacular views of the Pacific Ocean and Waihi Beach,  see bays with  mature pōhutukawa trees leaning over a sandy beach, and walks though coastal forest which includes kauri.

name: Otatara Pā Historic Reserve Walk
introduction: This short, easy walk through Otatara Pā has archaeological features from one of the largest and most ancient Māori pā sites, as well as commanding views of the coastline - it's a good option for kids.
locationString: Napier area, Otatara Pa Historic Reserve

name: Pakihi Walk
introduction: Pakihi Walk climbs through kamahi and rimu forest to a platform lookout.
locationString: Ōkārito area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Otoko Walkway
introduction: The Otoko Walkway is 50 km north-west of Gisborne. The track traverses 5 km of the old Gisborne/Moutohora railway line.

name: Pakotai Track
introduction: Take a short walk to a magnificant mature kauri.

name: Parapara Peak
introduction: The track to the summit of Parapara Peak (1249 m) is steep and difficult, and requires fitness and experience.

name: Punakaiki Pancake Rocks and Blowholes Walk
introduction: Explore a limestone landscape of pancake-shaped rock formations, blowholes and surge pools on this short, paved walk that's great for children.

name: Paines Ford Tramline Track
introduction: Walk to some excellent swimming holes on a track that follows an old tramline.

name: Papatowai walks
introduction: Explore the coastal area around Papatowai - where forest meets sea.

name: Pinnacles Track
introduction: Walk to the spectacular Putangirua Pinnacles or further for excellent views of Palliser Bay and Lake Onoke – the shorter options are suitable for kids.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Pinchgut Track
introduction: Follow the Okuku River to Pinchgut Hut.

name: Peak Hill Route
introduction: The climb to the top of Peak Hill rewards walkers with sweeping views of Lake Coleridge and its surrounds. The walk is extremely exposed to the weather and walkers should be well equipped.

name: Piripiri Cave Walk
introduction: Walk to a cave entrance with a viewing platform.

name: Peninsula Loop Walk
introduction: The Loop Walk around the headland provides a little of everything that Mimiwhangata has to offer.

name: Peach Cove Track
introduction: The 3-hour return walk along the Peach Cove Track requires skill and a reasonable level of fitness. The track has several steep climbs before it drops down to Peach Cove’s sandy beach.
locationString: Bream Head Scenic Reserve, Whangārei Heads area

name: Piroa Falls Track
introduction: Follow a 200 m track across the Ahuroa River and on to the picturesque Piroa Falls.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Pirongia summit via Hihikiwi Track
introduction: Take the shortest track to Pahautea Hut and Pirongia summit.

name: Picnic Gully track
introduction: This family-friendly track starts near Taieri Mouth.
locationString: Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area

name: Piwakawaka Track
introduction: Piwakawaka Track is easy walking track leading from the northern end of Elaine Bay to a small beach.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Pukawa Bay walks
introduction: Walk through ancient forest, experience spectacular lake vistas, and enjoy constant birdsong on a variety of walks on the southwestern shores of Lake Taupō.

name: Puriri Track
introduction: One of the bush walks at Mimiwhangata, the track leads you to the top of the ridge with impressive views of the peninsula and out towards the Poor Knights Islands.

name: Purity - Kelly Knight Hut Loop Track
introduction: A loop track that takes in the Pourangaki River valley and the open tops of the Hikurangi Range in the Ruahine Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Purakaunui Falls Walk
introduction: Walk to the well known and often photographed Purakaunui Falls.

name: Quartz Reef Point Walk
introduction: Take a short walk to Quartz Reef Point, the best preserved example of herring bone tailings in the country.

name: Pelorus Bridge Scenic Reserve walking tracks
introduction: Enjoy beautiful forest and river scenery on one of several walks - there are short, easy options for kids and a river for them to swim in too.

name: Rangatira Point Track
introduction: This easy walk winds through native bush along the lake edge, offering fantastic views and great picnic, swimming and fishing spots. It's perfect for families and those wanting to enjoy Lake Taupō.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Pukatea Ridge Track
introduction: This is a well-marked track through established bush with valley views and large kauri trees. This track connects with the Waipapa River Track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Rangitane Road to Crow Hut Loop Track
introduction: A very steep up and down tramp in Ruahine Forest Park, climbing first to the Mokai Patea Range, then dropping to the Kawhatau River and then back up to the Hikurangi Range and out to Rangitane Road via the Kawhatau River. Involves camping out.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Rangitoto Summit Track
introduction: An easy climb through pōhutukawa forest and lava fields gives way to panoramic views of Auckland and the Hauraki Gulf from the summit of this volcanic island. This is one of our best shorts.

name: Rangiwahia Hut Track
introduction: This well-graded track to the tussock tops on Whanahuia Range is a great overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Rerekapa Track
introduction: This track was made around 1910 by road workers using wheelbarrows, picks and shovels.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Routeburn Track: Key Summit Track
introduction: Enjoy panoramic views over mountains and alpine lakes on this half-day walk off Milford Road on the Routeburn Track - it's suitable families with children.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Rob Roy Track
introduction: This track offers an easy route (achievable by older children) into a dramatic alpine landscape that includes snowfields, glaciers, sheer rock cliffs and waterfalls.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Rotary Ride and Waikato River Track
introduction: These two tracks along the banks of the Waikato River allow for stunning views of the river, and access to Huka Falls and the network of mountain bike trails in the area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Roberts Point Track
introduction: The Roberts Point Track requires a good level of fitness. After walking one hour you will reach Hende's Hut. From there the track continues to climb on to Roberts Point where the glacier views are spectacular.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Ruakuri Walk
introduction: Discover a forested gorge, natural sculpted cliffs and low limestone arches on this spectacular loop walk - plenty to keep kids interested.

name: Routeburn Track: Lake Howden Track
introduction: For a taste of the Routeburn Track Great Walk or for an easy overnight tramp with kids, walk to Lake Howden with plenty of mountain and valley views along the way.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Ruapane Lookout
introduction: Climb to a lookout on Mount Pirongia with excellent views across the Waikato Basin to the Kaimai Ranges.

name: Ruakaka Pipeline Road Track
introduction: Ruakaka Pipeline Road Track is considered suitable for people of most fitness levels. The 3 km track provides back dune access to Bream Bay.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Sandymount Track
introduction: Walk to Sandymount and enjoy spectacular views of the coastline.

name: Sawyer Burn Track
introduction: The Sawyer Burn Track climbs through the forest to the bushline and has superb views of Lake Hāwea and the surrounding mountains.
walkDuration: 2 hr return to the bushline, 5 hr return to Sawyer Burn Hut

name: Scott Creek Track
introduction: This route is for experienced trampers. It is irregularly marked, steep and in parts obscure and washed out.

name: Scotts Saddle Track
introduction: Starting in Mt Hutt Forest and ending at Mount Hutt Skifield Road, Scotts Saddle Track offers beautiful views over mid-Canterbury.

name: Shotover Saddle Route
introduction: The Shotover Saddle Route offers magnificent views of the West Matukituki and Rob Roy valleys.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Signal Station Track
introduction: Enjoy spectacular views of the harbour and coastline on this short easy walk - it's suitable for children and buggies.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Smith Creek - Tauherenikau River
introduction: This is a daytrip in the southern Tararua Range and the exit/entry to the Kaitoke-Holdsworth Tramp.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Southern Circuit Stewart Island/Rakiura
introduction: Stewart Island/Rakiura's Southern Circuit Track is a remote, challenging tramp and requires good fitness, route-finding skills and backcountry experience.
walkDuration: 4 - 6 days round trip from Freshwater landing

name: Speargrass Track
introduction: For an easy overnight tramp, great for kids, walk to Speargrass Hut on this well graded track.

name: Square Kauri Tree
introduction: Climb a short track to marvel at an unusual square trunked kauri and enjoy the view across to Maumaupaki on the main Coromandel Range.

name: St Arnaud Range Track
introduction: Climb onto the St Arnaud Range for spectacular views of the surrounding area.

name: Sunrise Track
introduction: This well-graded track is a great overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers - it passes through changing forest types to the open tops, with great views of the Hawke’s Bay plains and excellent sunrises from the hut.

name: Talbot Forest Scenic Reserve tracks
introduction: These short walks in and around Talbot Forest Scenic Reserve are ideal for families. There are four short walks through the forest which interconnect with roads around the reserve.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Stanley River Route
introduction: This marked route links Charlies Saddle to Stanley Vale Hut in the St James Conservation Area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Tarawera Outlet to Humphries Bay
introduction: This area was extensively altered by the 1886 Tarawera eruption and the landscape is being slowly regenerated by native plant species.

name: Tangihua Forest Nature Walk
introduction: This family friendly nature walk winds through native forest and takes just over an hour one way.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Tasman River tracks
introduction: Tasman River is a large braided river which flows into Lake Pukaki. There are walking and cycling tracks in the area.

name: Taronui Bay Recreation Reserve Track
introduction: Walking the track will take you through a mixed landscape of pasture and wooded areas to the beautiful white sands of Taronui Bay.

name: Te Au Track
introduction: The track climbs to 521 m and offers panoramic views of the Waikanae Estuary and Kapiti Island.

name: Tāne Mahuta Walk
introduction: Visit New Zealand's largest known living kauri tree, Tāne Mahuta on this short, easy walk suitable for buggies and children.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Te Arapiki o Tawhaki
introduction: Experience stunning views and native bush on Te Arapiki o Tawhaki at Pukaha/Mount Bruce.

name: Te Kopia Walk
introduction: Enjoy views over a geothermal area on this short walk near Rotorua.
locationString: Rainbow Mountain,  Waiotapu and Te Kopia Scenic Reserves
locationArray: Rainbow Mountain, Waiotapu and Te Kopia Scenic Reserves

name: Te Kauri Park Circuit Walk
introduction: Walk alongside the attractive Waikuku Stream then climb up to good views of the surrounding countryside.

name: Waihaha Hut Track
introduction: Walk to Waihaha Hut for a short overnight trip.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Kere Haka Track
introduction: The Te Kere Haka Track follows the shore of Lake Wakatipu.

name: Centre of the North Island and Mount Titiraupenga tracks
introduction: Take a short walk to the Centre of the North Island or climb Mount Titiraupenga.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Werahi Beach Track
introduction: From Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, this 2 km track follows the West Coast leading you down past steep cliffs to the long, sweeping Te Werahi Beach.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Te Whara Track
introduction: Follow in the footsteps of Northland's Māori ancestors. This challenging track climbs through coastal forest before revealing a spectacular 360-degree panorama. It's one of our best day hikes.
locationString: Bream Head Scenic Reserve, Whangārei Heads area

name: Teal Bay to South Coast Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track heads from the southern shore of Lake Hauroko, over alpine tops on Hump Ridge and down to the coast at Te Waewae Bay.

name: Tikitapu Nature Walk
introduction: This short walk through beautiful forest has information panels about plant and birds along the way - it's a great option for children.

name: Toretore Island Walk
introduction: Located near Russell, this short walk traverses Toretore Island. It takes you through a young tōtara forest with views of the inner Bay of Islands and Paihia's off-shore islands.

name: Trotters Gorge tracks
introduction: Discover river sculpted caves or great views out to sea, as well as see and hear many of New Zealand's bush birds, on these tracks from Trotters Gorge Campsite.

name: Tokatoka Scenic Reserve Track
introduction: Climb to the top of Tokatoka and enjoy the stunning 360-degree views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Trounson Kauri Park Loop Track
introduction: Walk through a spectacular stand of kauri and experience the unique character of this ancient forest by day or night.

name: Top Dingle Hut Track
introduction: A track climbs from Ahuriri valley over Dingleburn Pass and descends to Top Dingle Hut in Dingle Burn valley.

name: Trains Track
introduction: Follow the Waitōtara River to Trains Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Tuhoto Ariki Trail
introduction: Specifically designed dual use trail through native bush with great downhills and some decent climbs for the mountain bikers. Starts from the highest point in Whakarewarewa Forest.

name: Twilight - Te Werahi Loop Track
introduction: The round-trip walk is 16 km in length and takes between 4 hours 30 minutes to 5 hours to complete. The track crosses farmlands and dunes.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Twizel Town tracks
introduction: These tracks are found within a few kilometres of Twizel.

name: Waiau Falls and Kauri Grove Lookout Walk
introduction: Visit a popular swimming hole at Waiau Falls and view a mature kauri grove on this walk.

name: Kapiti Island tracks and walks
introduction: Enjoy listening to and spotting birds on walks in two areas of Kapiti Island.

name: Waingongoro Hut tracks
introduction: Waingongoro Hut is a good overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers - walk through goblin forest, stop for a swim in lava-formed pools, and cross the highest swing bridge in Egmont National Park.
distance: 2.3 km one way | 2.9 km one way
locationString: Dawson Falls area, East Egmont area,Egmont National Park

name: Waikawau Track
introduction: This route for intrepid trampers is the longest track to Leitch's Hut.

name: Wainui Falls Track
introduction: A short walk through lush native bush leads to the cascading Wainui Falls, the largest and most accessible falls in Golden Bay/Mohua - there's a long swing bridge for children to enjoy as well. It's one of our best short walks.

name: Waiorongomai Valley tramping tracks
introduction: Explore pack tracks and tramlines from gold mining days - the shorter option is suitable for children and follows New Zealand’s oldest known railway (1882-83) with the original rail still in place.

name: Waipehi Walk
introduction: Starting from Motutere Bay on the eastern shores of Lake Taupō take in the views, the native bush and the volcanic heritage of the area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Waiomu Kauri Grove Walk
introduction: A 2-hour return walk allows you to visit one of the Coromandel Peninsula’s finest remaining kauri stands, Waiomu Kauri Grove.

name: Waipu Caves Track
introduction: From the caves, a 2-km walk leads you through a picturesque karst limestone landscape across farmland and regenerating bush to a point where you can take in the magnificent views. Within the entrance to the caves themselves, you will find stalactites, stalagmites and glow worms.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Waitaanga South Road to Te Rerepahupahu Falls Track
introduction: Follow an historic logging tramline to Te Rerepahupahu Falls.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area
locationArray: Mount Damper and Waitaanga Conservation Area

name: Wairoa Track
introduction: This track has been closed to prevent the spread of kauri dieback.

name: Waitengaue Track
introduction: Enjoy walking along the former Waitengaue bush tramway on this track that takes you to Waitawheta Hut.

name: Waitewaewae Hut Track
introduction: The track to Waitewaewae Hut crosses a terrace above the Otaki River, before entering the bush to follow an old tramway and criss-cross several creeks.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Waitomo Walkway
introduction: The Waitomo Walkway traverses classic limestone landscape, meanders beside the Waitomo Stream through forest and open farmland.

name: Wakarara Road end routes
introduction: There are a variety of tramping routes from Wakarara road end in the Eastern Ruahine Forest Park, including Gold Creek and Barlow Hut.

name: Waro Limestone Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: Walk around spectacular limestone formations - this is a good option for kids with open grassland for exploring as well.

name: Western Okataina Walkway
introduction: Western Okataina Walkway is open for both walking and mountain biking.

name: Washbourn Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: The Washbourn Scenic Reserve is a delightful patch of forest, providing a very easy 15-minute walk.

name: Tongariro Alpine Crossing
introduction:
From November to May, trek across a volcanic alpine landscape of dramatic contrasts.

From June to October, snow and ice means alpine skills and experience are essential - it's best to go with guide or choose another track.

name: Kaituna Valley Packhorse Hut Track
introduction: The walk to Packhorse Hut can be enjoyed as a half day walk but is also a great overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers.

name: Wether Range Tracks
introduction: The Wether Range tracks are found south of Omarama.

name: Kaituna Wetland Loop Track
introduction: Two loop tracks and a wonderful viewing hide have been built so you get up close and personal with the wetland.

name: Whakamaharatanga Walkway
introduction: The walkway crosses farmland through two old pā sites with  terraces, pits and middens (shell dumps). Most of the farmland was under water prior to the Napier earthquake in 1931.

name: Kakepuku Track
introduction: The Kakepuku Track in Kakepuku Historic Reserve climbs up through bush to the summit of Kakepuku, an old volcano.

name: Whakanui Track
introduction: This track leads from Wainuiomata to the Orongorongo River and offers views of the Remutaka Range and surrounding areas.

name: Motutapu Walkway
introduction: The Motutapu Walkway takes you from Islington Bay on Rangitoto Island across the causeway to Home Bay and Emu Bay on Motutapu Island.

name: Motutara Recreation Reserve Walk
introduction: The Motutara Recreation Reserve lies halfway between Russell and Whangārei. At the reserve you’ll find several small beaches and some good fishing and diving spots.

name: Mount Adams Route
introduction: Mount Adams sits proudly on the edge of the Adams Wilderness Area in the Southern Alps/Kā Tiritiri o te Moana, and is a focal point for travellers along State Highway 6 from Lake Ianthe to Lake Wahapo.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Whakapono and Tumanako tracks
introduction: The Whakapono and Tumanako tracks form a loop.  Plan for the walk to take about 2-3 hours if you wish to complete the full loop.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Wekaweka Track
introduction: Follow the gentle incline of an old coach road up the valley and onto the Mataraua Forest plateau.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Whangamarino Historic Walk
introduction: This short walk takes in the Whangamarino Redoubt and Te Teoteo's Pā - two key sites of conflict during the Waikato War of 1863-64.

name: Whangaparapara: Te Ahumata Track
introduction: Discover interesting flora and panoramic views at the top of Te Ahumata (398 m).

name: Whangamumu Track
introduction: Go for an easy forest and beach walk to Whangamumu Harbour and Te Toroa Bay. Learn about the history while challenging the kids.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Whangaparapara: Tramline and Withey Tracks
introduction: Combine these tracks with Forest Road for a circuit walk from Whangaparapara.

name: Whangaparapara: Old Mill Track
introduction: Discover the site of the Kauri Timber Company sawmill and an historic steam traction engine.

name: Wharekirauponga Track
introduction: The Wharekirauponga Track in Parakawai Valley and the Royal Standard Goldmine area follows along an old horse-drawn tram track.

name: Wharauroa and Mahaukura Lookouts
introduction: Climb up to one of the best views from Mount Pirongia of Hamilton and Te Awamutu.

name: Whisky Falls
introduction: Walk to these 40 m falls surrounded by thick walls of moss and ferns.

name: Mt McKerrow
introduction: Get panoramic views of Wainuiomata and the Hutt Valley as you climb to the top of Mt McKerrow.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Whirinaki Waterfall Loop Track
introduction: On the Whirinaki Waterfall Loop Track you'll follow the Whirinaki River as it flows through podocarp forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Wills Valley Track
introduction: This track is for experienced trampers and starts at the Gates of Haast Bridge. Like most of the smaller valleys in this area, the Wills’ lower reaches are gorged, and then open out to flats further up.
locationString: Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Willberg Walk
introduction: The Willberg Walk in Harihari climbs gently through rimu forest.

name: Windy Canyon and Palmer's Track to Mt Hobson (Hirakimata)
introduction: Windy Canyon is a popular walk on Great Barrier Island, offering spectacular views. You can then continue on Palmers Track to the summit of Mt Hobson (Hirakimata).
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Henga Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: This walk takes you out onto coastal dunes then back through the bush to your starting point.

name: Heyward Point Track
introduction: This cliff top track, through farm land and regenerating forest, offers great coastal views.

name: Yakas Walk
introduction: Walk to a large kauri tree - it's suitable for children but not for buggies.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Woodside Glen and Maungatua summit walks
introduction: You can walk from Outram and across Lee Creek, or for a more challenging walk follow the tramping track to the Maungatua (Maukaatua) summit.
walkDuration: 2 hr 30 min or 8 hr 30 min return

name: Fig Tree Track
introduction: This track is closed due to safety hazards.

name: Duke's Nose (Kaiaraara Rocks) Track
introduction: Take in spectacular views of Whangaroa Harbour from Duke's Nose.

name: Tutoko Valley Route
introduction: This challenging tramping route leads up the Tutoko river valley through beech forest and open flats under impressive Fiordland mountain peaks.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Okiwi Bay Lookout Walk
introduction: Enjoy views of the Kaikoura coastline.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area
locationArray: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area

name: Patutu Route
introduction: Climb to the summit of Patutu (1162 m) for great views of the coast and the North Island.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area
locationArray: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area

name: Tunnel Beach Track
introduction: This short walk goes through an excavated tunnel kids will love, to a secluded beach and a spectacular, rocky coastline.

name: Sanctuary Track
introduction: The Sanctuary Track is an easy loop track that goes through remnant podocarp forest. You can also walk it at night as the Whirinaki Night Life Walk.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Sawcut Gorge/Isolated Hill Route
introduction: Isolated Hill Scenic Reserve is typical South Marlborough: rugged bluffs and steep, dry hills drained by stony rivers.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Tui Track link from Boyle village
introduction: From Boyle village on SH7, you can pick up tracks that link the end of the St James Walkway with tracks in Hope valley and Doubtful River, Lake Sumner Forest Park.

name: Hay Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: This easy grade walk through a stand of lowland podocarp forest is suitable for small children and family groups.

name: Akaroa Head Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: You need a 4WD to get to the start of this track, which takes you past the old Akaroa lighthouse keeper's house.

name: Cape Kidnappers/Te Kauwae-a-Māui Walking Track
introduction: The track is closed for public safety due to major rock falls.

name: Kaituna Valley Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: The outstanding feature of this 6 ha reserve is the stand of New Zealand ash/tītoki.

name: Nīkau Palm Gully Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: Walk to a small forest pocket of nīkau palms and enjoy views of the Akaroa Marine Reserve. The walks crosses private land and you need to ring the landowner beforehand to get permission.

name: Mount Pureora via Toitoi Track
introduction: Walk to the summit of Mount Pureora from The Timber Trail.

name: Ellangowan Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: Walk to a reserve that has beech trees and is home to a variety of interesting herbs.

name: Mount Pureora from Link Road
introduction: On a clear day, enjoy views across Lake Taupo, the Mamaku Ranges, Mount Taranaki and Mount Ruapehu from the summit of Mount Pureora.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Ketemaringi Route
introduction: Climb to the Ketemaringi Trig.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Tutakakahikura Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: You need a 4WD vehicle to get to the start of the walk to Tutakakahikura Scenic Reserve, a narrow stand of remnant red beech/tawairaunui forest.

name: Waipapa Loop Track
introduction: This short loop walk in the Waipapa ecological area takes you through tall podocarp with spectacular bird life.

name: Mangawhero Falls Walk
introduction: Enjoy excellent views of a beautiful waterfall close to the road.

name: Whakapapanui Walk
introduction: Follow Whakapapanui Stream and enjoy the shelter of the forest.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Truman Track
introduction: Walk through unspoiled subtropical forest to a spectacular coastline.

name: Ball Hut Route
introduction: Walk to Ball Hut with superb views of the Tasman Glacier and surrounding peaks.

name: Bealey Spur Track
introduction: Experience stunning views in fine weather from a more gradual track than most alpine tracks around Arthur's Pass village.

name: Cons Track
introduction: Follow a steep ridge to the bush line.

name: Mt Aitken Track
introduction: Climb steeply to the bush line.

name: Ohakune short walks
introduction: Explore the forest on these short walks in Ohakune.

name: Pororari River tracks
introduction: Follow a spectacular limestone gorge on a short walk, or make a loop for a longer walk. The Pororari River Track is the pedestrian entry/exit for the Paparoa Great Walk.

name: Holly Hut Track
introduction: Walk to Holly Hut for a day or overnight tramp.

name: Adams Flat walks and tracks
introduction: Walk to a replica goldminer's hut and the site of the Adams Creek Workings.

name: Te Waikoropupū Springs Walk
introduction: Experience New Zealand's largest freshwater springs and the largest coldwater springs in the southern hemisphere, with some of the clearest water ever measured.

name: Six Mile Walk
introduction: Explore what remains of the old Six Mile hydro power station.

name: The Grove Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: Walk through limestone blocks draped with tentacle-like roots of northern rātā, to a viewpoint over the surrounding area.

name: Goldsborough short walks
introduction: Explore the area around Goldsborough Campsite on these short walks. Kids will love the option with tunnels.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Lake Rotoiti (Kerr Bay) walks
introduction: Explore Kerr Bay on Lake Rotoiti on these short walks and experience the outcomes of the Rotoiti Nature Recovery Project.

name: Whirinaki Recreation Camp tracks
introduction: Walk through native forest, along the Whirinaki River or uphill to great views, on these short walks from the Whirinaki Recreation Camp.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Pua-a-Tāne Circuit
introduction: The Te Pua-a-Tāne Circuit is the ultimate Whirinaki challenge for the more adventurous.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Kaitarakihi Summit Track
introduction: This track takes you to one of the distinctive peaks of the Coromandel ranges.

name: Arawata Bridle Track
introduction: The Arawata Bridle Track follows part of  the original bridle trail that connected Queenstown and Glenorchy.

name: Outlet and Hikuwai Link tracks
introduction: The Outlet and Hikuwai Link tracks cross the Hikuwai Conservation Area. They offer views of the Clutha River/ Mata–Au and Lake Wānaka.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Saddle Hill Summit Track
introduction: This family-friendly walk has stunning views of Akaroa Harbour, Kaitorete, and the peaks of Banks Peninsula to the South Alps.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Wilderness Lookout Walk
introduction: This walk leads to a viewing platform over ancient bog pine forest, with marvellous views of Fiordland National Park and surrounding land.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Rock Peak Track
introduction: Get great views from this track at the southern end of the Pisa range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Awaroa/Godley Head Loop Track
introduction: This walk features a beach, coastal views and WWII remains – plenty to keep children interested.

name: Major Hornbrook Track
introduction: Enjoy sweeping views back down into Lyttelton Harbour and across to Banks Peninsula and a good day you can see Canterbury Plains to the Kaikoura ranges to the north.

name: Lake Gault Track
introduction: A gradual climb on a historical tramping track through ancient podocarp forest provides panoramic views of Aoraki /Mount Cook. If you’re lucky, you can enjoy the mountain landscape reflected in Lake Gault.
locationString: Fox Glacier area, Westland Tai Poutini National Park

name: Eldrig Peak Route
introduction: This quite steep and difficult tramping track leads from the Borland Road through beech forest then into the tops where you can enjoy gorgeous views of Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Te Waiti Hut Walk
introduction: This track affords views of Te Waiti Stream and lowland forest and is suitable for a family day trip.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Eliza Mine Loop Track
introduction: Evidence of the past can be savoured today as trampers walk through the Eliza Mine Loop Track.

name: Te Tapui Loop Track
introduction: A loop track follows through the bush and up to the summit, with a lookout tower and great views across to the Kaimai Ranges and Firth of Thames.

name: Cattle Ridge Track
introduction: This track gives outstanding views of the Remutaka Range and Orongorongo Valley.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Ohakune Old Coach Road
introduction: Take a trip back into New Zealand's rail heritage while you walk or cycle an old coach road. The road was used to carry passengers and goods between two railheads on the North Island main trunk link before they were linked in 1908.

name: Maratoto - Wentworth Crossing
introduction: Experienced trampers can cross from Maratoto to Wentworth.

name: Cave Stream Scenic Reserve tracks and cave walk
introduction: Two short walks lead to the cave entrances – you can can also walk through the cave passage which meanders and twists in pitch darkness for 594 m between the two entrances.

name: Marawaiwai Track
introduction: Marawaiwai Track runs alongside a meandering stream through kahikitea forest. It is suitable for all the family.

name: Marokopa Falls Walk
introduction: Walk to the beautiful 35 m high Marokopa Falls.

name: Taipo River Track to Harman Pass
introduction: The Taipo Valley is often travelled as part of a popular route from the Waimakariri River via Harman Pass. This guide describes the route from SH73 to Harman Pass only.

name: Manuka Bay Track (Port Robinson Walkway)
introduction: The Manuka Bay track links Port Robinson with the mouth of the Hurunui River. Passing through a variety of coastal scenery, this easy tramping grade track is ideal for family groups.

name: Manuherikia River tracks
introduction: These well-formed tracks lead into Oteake Conservation Park.

name: Maungauika/North Head Historic Walk
introduction: Explore defences that were placed on the headland to protect Auckland from feared Russian invasions.

name: Maunganui Bluff Track
introduction: Climb up and over an ancient volcanic crater for some of the best views in the region - pass through some pristine coastal vegetation dominated by Pohutukawa.
distance: 2.6 km to Maunganui Bluff | 5.3 km to Waikara Beach
walkDuration: 1 hr 30 min to Maunganui Bluff | 5 hr to Waikara Beach

name: Craig Burn Track
introduction: Read about the gold mining history of the area at the carpark then walk to a pleasant picnic spot.

name: Mangamuka Tramping Track
introduction: The Mangamuka Tramping Track takes you through scenic Raetea Forest, a track made for the adventurous at heart.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Raetea Forest and Mangamuka Gorge Scenic Reserve
locationArray: Raetea Forest and Mangamuka Gorge Scenic Reserve

name: Mt Holdsworth - Jumbo Circuit
introduction: The classic Mt Holdsworth - Jumbo Circuit is a two to three day tramp involving a climb through beech-podocarp forest to some of the best alpine tops travel in the Tararua Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Kapowairua (Spirits Bay) to Pandora
introduction: This 3 hour walk along beautiful Spirits Bay takes you to Pandora where you can stop to observe shore birds or camp for the night.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Douglas Range
introduction: The route links the Aorere and Cobb valleys in Golden Bay. It is unmarked and suitable for trampers with a high degree of fitness and off-track experience.

name: Sutton Salt Lake walk
introduction: Take a self-guided loop walk around Sutton Salt Lake, New Zealand's only inland salt lake.

name: Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park tracks
introduction: Choose from shorter walks good for children or longer walks across farmland - discover a lighthouse and a spectacular rugged coastline.
locationString: Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park
locationArray: Farewell Spit and Puponga Farm Park

name: Molesworth Recreation Reserve tramping tracks
introduction: There are five tramping tracks accessible from the Acheron Road; from short tracks from the cob buildings at Molesworth and Acheron to longer tracks with panorama views.

name: Sylvester Hut Track
introduction: Walk up to Sylvester Hut as day walk or overnight tramp with children - enjoy great views from the hut and explore a series of lakes on the open tops behind the hut.

name: Lake Christabel tracks
introduction: A number of tracks lead to a hut at Lake Christabel.

name: Lake Okataina walking tracks
introduction: Walk one of the numerous short walks at Lake Okataina Scenic Reserve or link them together for a longer walk.

name: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay Track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike through varied vegetation and enjoy ocean views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area
locationArray: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area

name: Karangarua and Douglas valleys routes
introduction: The Karangarua and Douglas valleys offer hunters, trampers and mountaineers many challenging opportunities and rewards within the rugged backcountry environment of Westland Tai Poutini National Park.

name: Rapurapu Kauri Track
introduction: This walking track is a beautiful cool, retreat during the summer months.

name: Ratapihipihi Scenic Reserve walk
introduction: Walk through an outstanding example of a subtropical rain forest past a scenic waterfall on this well-graded short walk - with a sheltered picnic at the car park it's great option for families.

name: Nydia Track, Marlborough Sounds
introduction: The 27-km Nydia Track in the Sounds area of Marlborough is an easy 2-day tramp. Plan on an overnight stop at Nydia Bay.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Table Flat - Kashmir Roadend West-East crossing
introduction: A west east traverse of the Ruahine Forest Park, following the Oroua River valley and over the main Ruahine Range to the Kashmir Roadend.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Tramline Track
introduction: The Tramline Track system traverses most of Great Barrier island at its widest point.

name: Kelceys Bush tracks
introduction: Stroll to a small waterfall or picnic along a sparkling stream and listen to the bird song.
walkDuration: 20 min one way | 40 min one way

name: Kea Basin Track
introduction: It takes half a day to climb to this beautiful sub-alpine tussock basin beneath Mt Earnslaw/Pikirakatahi.

name: Blue Lake Track
introduction: Enjoy native bush and quiet beaches. The track provides good opportunities to look out over the Blue Lake (Tikitapu) and Green Lake (Rotokakahi).

name: Rarawa Beach Walk
introduction: This short walking track takes you to Rarawa beach.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Oparara Valley Track
introduction: Extend the Moria Gate Loop short walk and experience ancient native forest on a longer walk.

name: Lake Rotoiti (West Bay) walks
introduction: Explore West Bay on Lake Rotoiti on these short walks.

name: Kea Point Track
introduction: Walk to a viewing deck with stunning views of the surrounding area.
walkDuration: 2 hr return from village or 1 hr return from campground

name: Black Hill Hut tracks
introduction: Walk to Black Hill Hut on one of these tracks or combine them to make a circuit.

name: Ballroom Overhang Track
introduction: Experience some of the park's finest limestone features, including a large limestone outcrop.

name: Edwards - Hawdon Route
introduction: This route takes you through spectacular rock-fall, past mountain tarns and over two alpine passes.

name: East Ahuriri Track
introduction: East Ahuriri Track is part of Te Araroa.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: East Eglinton Track
introduction: This challenging tramping route leads from the Milford Road, up the East Eglinton river valley through beech forest.
walkDuration: 2 hr one way to river forks
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Mt McIntosh Loop Track
introduction: A steep overnight tramp with magnificent views through open tussock land.

name: Motatapu Track
introduction: The Motatapu Track follows much of an historic route that linked the Wanaka and Arrowtown areas. It's a demanding alpine tramp for experienced parties.
locationString: Arrowtown area, Macetown Historic Reserve,Wanaka area

name: Routeburn Track
introduction: The Routeburn Track was damaged from flooding in February 2020, however can be walked as a 4-day 3-night return experience .
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: East Matukituki Valley tracks
introduction: The East Matukituki Valley provides interesting day walks and access to several demanding tramping and climbing routes in Mount Aspiring National Park.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Borland Nature Walk
introduction: This easy loop track in Fiordland forest in Monowai is suitable for families.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Slapjack Saddle Track
introduction: Journey through the Carrick Range, past the spectacular Long Gully bluffs. There are brilliant views from the tops and golden colours in the lower reaches during autumn.

name: Bob’s Cove Track & Nature Walk
introduction: This short walk passes through native bush to reach a stunning cove on Lake Wakatipu - it's a great option for kids.

name: Deadmans Track
introduction: This challenging tramping route from the Hollyford Road climbs the slope to meet the Routeburn Track near Harris Saddle.

name: Kepler Track: Rainbow Reach to Shallow Bay or Moturau Hut
introduction: To sample the Kepler Track (a Great Walk) or for an easy overnight tramp for kids, follow this track through beech forest to Moturau Hut and Shallow Bay on Lake Manapouri.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area,Lake Te Anau area

name: Roys Peak Track
introduction: Take in breathtaking views over Lake Wānaka, Mount Aspiring/Tititea and surrounding peaks after a steep climb through alpine meadows and tussock grasslands to the summit. This is a popular track and one of our best day hikes.

name: Mavora - Greenstone Walkway
introduction: This is a 50 km, four day tramping trip, linking the Mavora Lakes Camping Area with the Greenstone Track. It passes through open valley tussock land and beech forested hill country.

name: Mt Burns Tarns Track
introduction: This enjoyable, short tramping track offers a superb setting and views from Mt Burns, Monowai, Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Mt Crichton Loop Track
introduction: This well formed track features rivers, a waterfall, a historic hut/tunnel, native bush and views - plenty to keep kids interested.

name: Twin Kauri Track
introduction: This track is closed until further notice due to kauri dieback disease being found in the vicinity.

name: Twilight Beach to Te Paki Stream
introduction: This 4 hour 30 minute track leads you past Scott Point to the famous 90 Mile Beach and the Te Paki sand dunes.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Ngamarama/Te Tuhi Track
introduction: A challenging east-west crossing of the Kaimai Ranges featuring stream crossings and historic tramways.

name: Pirongia summit via Mahaukura and Tirohanga Tracks
introduction: Choose a there-and-back track to the summit of Mount Pirongia, or combine the tracks for a circuit trip to Pahautea Hut.

name: Allans Beach Track
introduction: Walk 5 minutes from the carpark to Allans Beach and see sea lions and penguins.

name: Alpine Nature Walk
introduction: The Alpine Nature Walk in Lewis Pass provides an opportunity to break up a long drive while enjoying spectacular scenery and beech forest.

name: Wairau Lagoons Walkway
introduction: This flat loop track, ideal for kids, follows the lagoon shoreline with good bird watching to the rusting remains of the Waverley ship.

name: Wairakau Stream Track
introduction: This track is for experienced trampers. It first climbs over a saddle to an old farm road and then descends through regenerating forest to Wairakau Stream. It ends at Lane Cove Hut.

name: Lake Peel tracks
introduction: Walk to the beautiful basin that holds Lake Peel.

name: Mt Richmond routes
introduction: These tracks provide access to Mt Richmond (1760 m) and can be combined for weekend round trip.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Alice Nash Memorial Heritage Lodge Track
introduction: This track in the scenic Oroua River valley can be enjoyed as a half day tramp but it's also a good overnight tramp for families with children and new trampers.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Toaroha/Zit Saddle/Kokatahi/Lathrop Saddle/Styx River  Route
introduction: This route traverses alpine ridges and crosses two alpine saddles. It demands experience and good route finding skills in other than fine weather conditions.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Pavilion Peak Track
introduction: This track traverses a range in the Lindis Conservation Area.

name: Broken Hills walking tracks
introduction: The Broken Hills area has a number of walking tracks through old mining sites.
locationString: Broken Hills area, Coromandel Forest Park

name: St James Walkway
introduction: This track passes through pastoral land, beech forest and sub-alpine regions, and is a great introduction to multi-night tramping.
locationString: Lewis Pass Scenic Reserve, St James Conservation Area

name: Kānuka Track
introduction: Kānuka Loop Track is the only DOC-managed bush walk in Central Otago.

name: Twizel area tracks
introduction: There is a diverse range of tracks within a short distance of Twizel.

name: Copland Track to Welcome Flat Hut
introduction: This popular tramp gives a glimpse of Westland’s spectacular forest, river and mountain scenery, with natural hot pools at Welcome Flat an added attraction.

name: Marsden Cross Track
introduction: This walk, suitable for kids, leads across farmland to the site of the first mission settlement in New Zealand.

name: Martins Bay Track
introduction: Walk along open grassy terrances and through low coastal scrub to the shoreline of the inner Hokianga Harbour.

name: Moki Track
introduction: The track was developed with wheelbarrows, picks and shovels as early as 1910. Both ends of the track pass through some 3 km of farmland before entering the forest, which contains good stands of tawa, kamahi and rimu.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Maryburn Stream Track
introduction: This track gives access to Maryburn Stream, or carry on further to Simons Hill.

name: Purity Hut Track
introduction: A steep climb to this hut nestled above the bushline on the Hikurangi Range in the Ruahine Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: York Road Loop Track
introduction: Explore the remnants of the old Egmont Branch railway quarry complex while walking through native forest.

name: Youngman Stream Track
introduction: Follows Ashley River to Youngman Stream Hut.

name: Mt Difficulty tracks
introduction: Enjoy fantastic views of Gibbston Valley and Cromwell basin along the way, and out to the Doolan mountains from the top.

name: Purity to Kawhatau Base Track
introduction: Walk along the tussock tops of the Hikurangi Range between Purity and McKinnon huts in the Ruahine Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Nikau Bush Conservation Area Walk
introduction: A short track follows a loop that takes in some peaceful forest glades in among lush regeneration beneath stately palms.

name: Ruahine Corner to Rangitane Road
introduction: An excellent but strenuous trip in the remote north western Ruahine Forest Park renowned for its scenery and ecological values. Fly in by helicopter and walk out.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Nikau Flat and Kotepato Tracks
introduction: These two scenic tracks offer excellent opportunity for trout fishing and hunting.  The Nikau Flat Track follows alongside the Waioeka River and the Kotepato Track follows alongside the Te Pato Stream.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Lake Hauroko to Teal Bay Hut Track
introduction: This rather difficult tramping track in the Lake Hauroko area goes around the lake via bays and bush-clad ridges towards Teal Bay Hut.

name: Archer Track
introduction: This walking and mountain biking track passes through native and pine forest from Penzance Bay to Elaine Bay.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area
locationArray: Pelorus Sound/Te Hoiere and Kenepuru Sound area

name: Lake Hauroko Track
introduction: This easy loop walking track skirts a swampy area close to Lake Hauroko in southern Fiordland.

name: Hakarimata Walkway
introduction: Walk the length of the Hakarimata Range and enjoy excellent views towards the coast and across the Waikato Basin.

name: Arohaki Lagoon Track
introduction: Arohaki Lagoon is one of the must see sites in the Whirinaki.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Breast Hill Track
introduction: This tramping track, taking 2-3 days to complete, forms part of the Te Araroa - The Long Pathway and connects to the Timaru River Track.

name: Ohinetonga Track
introduction: Walk through a variety of attractive scenery - with picnic areas and good places to swim as well this track is a good option with children.

name: Ōkārito walking tracks
introduction: North of the Franz Josef Township sits the coastal settlement of Ōkārito and the Ōkārito Lagoon. The lagoon is home to more than 76 species of native birds including the kōtuku/white heron and royal spoonbills.

name: Around the Mountain Circuit
introduction: The challenging Around the Mountain Circuit (AMC) offers you spectacular bush and alpine scenery. It is best tramped from October to April.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Okareka Mistletoe Walk
introduction: The short walk for the whole family provides views of the threatened native mistletoe.

name: Teal Bay to Lake Poteriteri Hut Route
introduction: This challenging tramping route travels through remote southern Fiordland forested valleys between Lake Hauroko and Lake Poteriteri.

name: West Matukituki Track
introduction: The walk to Aspiring Hut, with views up and down the West Matukituki Valley, is a great overnight tramp for families with children. It leads onto French Ridge and Liverpool Hut tracks.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Blue Lakes and Tasman Glacier walks
introduction: View New Zealand's longest glacier, the mighty Haupapa/Tasman Glacier on one of our best short walks.

name: Tatare Tunnels Walk
introduction: The 80-minute walk follows an old 4WD road then the tracks climbs to the old water tunnels. You will need a torch and raincoat to explore the tunnels.
locationString: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere, Westland Tai Poutini National Park
locationArray: Franz Josef Glacier/Kā Roimata o Hine Hukatere

name: Taumarumaru Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: This short walk features great views and access to a small beach - with a pa site to explore as well this easy walk is a great option for children.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Clarke Flat & Te Wanahu Flat tracks
introduction: Discover a variety of vegetation and a waterfall on these walks - shorter options are suitable for children.

name: Lake Emily tracks
introduction: Lake Emily gives good access to Manuka Hut, and old farm tracks to Stour Bridge car park. It's also the starting point for the section of Te Araroa through to the Rakaia River.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Hopkins valley tracks
introduction: Hopkins valley, in Ruataniwha Conservation Park, is near Lake Ōhau.

name: Lake Hanlon Track
introduction: Walk to this scenic gem from the main road, south of Karamea.

name: Box Canyon and Crazy Paving Caves
introduction: Explore two caves in the Oparara Basin - kids will love them.

name: Big Rimu Walk
introduction: Walk to a spectacular rimu tree, 36 m high and 2 m in diameter, near Karamea.

name: Kōhaihai area short walks
introduction: Enjoy beautiful nīkau forest on these easy walks from Kohaihai Campsite.

name: Waihaha and Waihora tracks
introduction: Explore the remote bush, cliffs and waterfalls of the Western Bays of Lake Taupō. Normally accessible only by boat, these trails take you through a variety of landscapes with fantastic lookout points.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Knights Track to Pohangina Valley East Road
introduction: There is a bit of everything on this tramp in the Ruahine Forest Park - open tops, rivers and bush travel.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Dingle Burn Track
introduction: A two to three-day tramping track through an upland valley in Hāwea Conservation Park. It also provides access to Ahuriri Conservation Park.

name: Mangakara Nature Walk
introduction: This loop walk passes through ancient forest with towering trees and a beautiful stream - with interpretation signs as well this is a great option for children.

name: Government Track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike the Government Track which traverses the slopes of the beech-and mānuka-forested Waipori Valley.
locationString: Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area

name: Deans Bank Track
introduction: This loop walking and mountain biking track meanders along the upper slopes of the Clutha river and offers spectacular views of surrounding peaks and Otago landscapes.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Pearl Flat to head of the valley
introduction: This track climbs through beech forest crossing swingbridges to bring you to the head of the Matukituki Valley.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Three Passes Route
introduction: This classic summer tramp for experienced backcountry trampers crosses Harman Pass, Whitehorn Pass and Browning Pass/Noti Raureka. It gives the excitement, variety and contrast of a transalpine route.

name: Isthmus Track
introduction: This track is dominated by the majestic Mount Tarawera.

name: J.M. Barker (Hapupu) National Historic Reserve Walk
introduction: See Moriori rakau momori (tree carvings) on this bush walk.

name: Pirongia summit via Bell & Tahuanui Tracks
introduction: Combine these tracks for an overnight circuit to Pahautea Hut and Mount Pirongia.

name: Lindemann Loop Track
introduction: There is a popular lookout through this track with scenic views over the northern Bay of Plenty.

name: Tarawera Trail
