introduction: Meander your way through bush from Te Wairoa to Hot Water Beach Campsite. Stay overnight or pre-book a water taxi to The Landing.

name: Rangituhi/Colonial Knob Walk
introduction: Climb to the summit of this 468 m peak for views on clear day from the Inland Kaikoura Range in the south to Mt Taranaki in the north-west - it's a good option for older children.

name: Pandora to Tapotupotu Bay
introduction: This 9 km walk between Pandora and Tapotupotu Bay mainly follows old farm tracks until you reach idyllic Tapotupotu Bay.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Waoku Coach Road Track
introduction: Follow the gentle incline of an historic coach road through the heart of the Mataraua Forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lake Tūtira tracks
introduction: There are two main walks at Lake Tūtira, a short walk along the edge of the lake or a longer loop through the reserve.

name: Aorangi Crossing
introduction: Cross the Aorangi Range from Putangirua Pinnacles to Cape Palliser.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Pukeatua Track
introduction: Pukeatua Track connects Otaki Forks to Waikanae.

name: Rocky's Walk to Tinker's Gully
introduction: Rocky’s walk takes you through an old mining area just north of Thames.

name: Angelus Hut tracks and routes
introduction: Angelus, at 1,650 metres, is perched high on the ranges between Lakes Rotoiti and Rotoroa in Nelson Lakes National Park.

name: Awa Nohoaka Conservation Area access tracks
introduction: Short tussock and pasture grasslands contrast with grey shrublands, dry shrublands and kanuka shrublands make up this unique conservation area.

name: Inland Pack Track
introduction: Experience some of the finest features of Paparoa National Park.

name: Harman Pass Route
introduction: This route takes you from the open east-coast river flats over a rugged, untracked alpine pass into the rainforest of the Taipo River.
locationString: Arthur's Pass National Park, Kelly Range - Styx River area

name: Lake Kaurapataka Route
introduction: This track starts and finishes at Aickens car park beside SH73, 5 km west of Ōtira township.

name: Lake Kaniere Walkway
introduction: Walk or mountain bike along the western shores of Lake Kaniere through lush lakeside forest, passing many picturesque bays and numerous forest streams.

name: Lewis Pass - Waiau Pass - Blue Lake Route
introduction: Waiau Pass is an alpine crossing suitable for experienced parties only, linking Lewis Pass and Nelson Lakes National Park.
locationString: Lewis Pass Scenic Reserve, Nelson Lakes National Park,St James Conservation Area

name: Whitcombe Pass Track
introduction: The Whitcombe Pass Track takes you through the very rugged bush clad valleys of the lower Hokitika and Whitcombe Rivers to the Main Divide.  This guide describes the route from the Hokitika road end to Whitcombe Pass only.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Carroll Hut Track
introduction: Climb steeply up to Carroll Hut for good views (on fine days) down the Taramakau River to the West Coast.

name: Aoraki/Mount Cook village short walks
introduction: Several walks around the village provide views of Aoraki/Mount Cook and the surrounding native alpine bush - these short, easy options are great for kids.

name: Godley valley tracks
introduction: Walk or mountain bike up the Godley valley.

name: Hooker Valley Track
introduction: Enjoy the awe-inspiring landscapes of the Southern Alps/Kā Tiritiri o te Moana on one of our best day hikes - wind up the Hooker Valley past alpine streams and glaciers in the shadow of Aoraki/Mount Cook.

name: Tirohanga Dunes Trail
introduction: On this easy, beautiful trail, you’ll enjoy panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean, Whakaari/White Island, Moutohora/Whale Island and towards East Cape.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Cass-Lagoon Saddle Track
introduction: Cass - Lagoon Saddle in Craigieburn Forest Park is a two-day round trip suitable for fit, moderately experienced and equipped parties.

name: Kura Tāwhiti Access Track
introduction: Wander through majestic limestone rock formations of special significance to Ngāi Tahu. It's one of our best short walks.

name: Potts River tracks
introduction: Explore tussock terraces in the Potts River area.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Piano Flat & Waikaia Forest tramping tracks
introduction: Waikaia Forest is a large island of beech forest, nestled in the mountain farmlands of northern Southland. Piano Flat, a grassy enclosure at the southern end, provides a picnic area, camping ground and several walking tracks.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Johnson Creek Track
introduction: Walk to and through a big slip formed in the 1929 Murchison earthquake.

name: Maruia Falls Track
introduction: Walk to a waterfall created following the 1929 Murchison earthquake.

name: Skyline Walk
introduction: Walk up to a viewpoint over Murchison township, and the Matakitaki, Buller and Matiri rivers.

name: Forest Road (Port FitzRoy - Whangaparapara)
introduction: Discover a wide array of beautiful bush and mountain views.

name: Wakamarina Track
introduction: Follow in the footsteps of old goldminers on the Wakamarina Track to cross the Richmond Range from the Wairau Valley to the Wakamarina Valley.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Hakarimata Summit Track
introduction: Climb to the summit of Hakarimata (374 m) and enjoy good views for the summit tower out towards the coast, across the Waikato Basin and down to Ruapehu.

name: Coromandel Walkway and mountain bike track
introduction: Walk or mountain bike between Fletcher Bay and Stony Bay.

name: Kaiaraara Track to Mt Hobson (Hirakimata)
introduction: Walk to the remains of the old kauri dam, and up to the summit of Mt Hobson (Hirakimata) for a 360-degree panorama.

name: Ohau Stream Walk - closed
introduction: The Ohau Stream Walk is unsafe due to earthquake damage and is closed until further notice.
locationString: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area
locationArray: Okiwi Bay - Half Moon Bay area

name: Northern Tangihua Track
introduction: The Northern Track links up with other tracks in the Tangihua Forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua Lighthouse Walk
introduction: Enjoy outstanding panoramic views and pay respect to a site steeped in Maori tradition on a short stroll to an iconic lighthouse - it's suitable for children and buggies.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Cape Foulwind Walkway
introduction: A seal colony, a lighthouse and panoramic views of mountains and coastline feature on this spectacular coastal walkway. With the beach close by as well it's a good option for children. It's also one of our best short walks.

name: Hauhungaroa Track
introduction: Traverse the Hauhungaroa Range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Carrington Hut Route
introduction: This route up the braided river-bed of the Waimakariri leads to a comfortable hut situated below the park’s highest peaks. Carrington Hut is a good base for exploring the upper Waimakariri catchment.

name: Lake Ngatu Track
introduction: Enjoy an easy walk with the family around Lake Ngatu - a freshwater dune lake and recreation reserve. The lake is popular with water sport enthusiasts, day visitors, and locals.

name: Taita Bridle Track
introduction: This moderately challenging track leads into the beautiful and rugged Waima Forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lake Monowai Peninsula Lookout Track
introduction: This pleasant, short walking track leads through beech forest to a lookout at Lake Monowai, Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Ruapani Circuit Track
introduction: It will take you six hours of moderate to hard walking to complete the Ruapani Circuit. The track is accessed from the Waikareiti Track and passes through beautiful forest and seven wetlands.

name: Te Werahi Beach to Twilight Beach
introduction: Experience gorgeous peach-coloured dunes, unusual dune grasses, and views of Cape Maria van Diemen and Motuopao Island on this 3-hour track to Twilight Beach.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Urchin and Umukarikari tracks
introduction: Climb above the bush line to the exposed alpine ridge of Umukarikari and Mount Urchin. Enjoy fantastic views and access the Waipakihi valley and hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Tangoio Falls Scenic Reserve tracks
introduction: Discover Te Ana or Tangoio Falls on a short, easy walk suitable for kids, or take a longer walk through native bush on the Tangoio Walkway.

name: Tapotupotu Bay to Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua
introduction: Starting at Tapotupotu Bay, this 5 km track offers incredible views before descending into Sandy Bay and on to the Cape Reinga lighthouse. An option for families camping at Tapotupotu.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Tapeka Point Track
introduction: This easy track is just 1 km north of Maiki/Flagstaff Hill, near Russell.  Tapeka Point is the perfect base for exploring this part of the Bay of Islands by land or water.

name: Lake Mistletoe Track
introduction: This easy, short walking track is suitable for all ages, wandering from the Milford Road through forest to peaceful Lake Mistletoe.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Tararua Southern Crossing
introduction: The Southern Crossing is one of the four classic tramps of the Tararua Range.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Bryant Memorial Reserve tracks
introduction: Two short walking tracks leaving from the Bryant Memorial Reserves.

name: Clay Ridge Track
introduction: Climb up to Mt McKerrow for a great view of Wellington harbour and the surrounding hills near the top.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Lake Dispute to Moke Lake Track
introduction: From Lake Dispute you can walk to Moke Lake.

name: Lake Dispute Track
introduction: Zigzag up to a high country lake that is a popular fishing spot for trout.

name: Hump Ridge Track
introduction: A 3-day loop with marvellous views from sub-alpine tops and rugged coastline in southern Fiordland. Hut bookings required.

name: Dusky Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track between Lake Hauroko and Lake Manapouri offers huge lakes, gushing rivers, vast forested valleys and lots of mud for experienced and well equipped trampers.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Southern fiords area

name: Skyline Track
introduction: The Skyline Track is a challenging tramping track in the Wanaka area.

name: Hump Ridge Track: Guided walk
introduction: This 3 day guided loop for more experienced walkers, takes you along the south coast of New Zealand up to the subalpine Hump Ridge zone, over historic viaducts in the heart of the native forest. Rest in easy-access, comfortable backcountry lodges.

name: Temple valley tracks
introduction: These short tramping tracks travel through mountain beech forest.

name: Historic Waihohonu Hut
introduction: Walk to the historic Waihohonu Hut, built in 1903/04 and used as a stopover for stage coaches.

name: Rakiura Track
introduction: Escape on an island adventure - relax and unwind in the peaceful surroundings with the bush, birds and beach at your side.

name: Silica Rapids Walk
introduction: Experience a range of vegetation types as well as the creamy-white Silica Rapid terraces.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Holdsworth roadend to Powell Hut/Mount Holdsworth
introduction: This tramp follows the Mount Holdsworth Track to Powell Hut. From the rocky outcrop below the hut you get a view of High Ridge and Totara Flats far below.
walkDuration: Powell Hut: 5 – 6 hr, Mount Holdsworth: 7 – 8 hr
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Homestead Run
introduction:
For young families or riders with insufficient time or
experience to attempt the full St James Cycle Trail, the Homestead Run will give you a taste of St James.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Honeycomb Rock Walkway
introduction: Honeycomb Rock is a spectacular outcrop on the Wairarapa coast, so named because of the cell-like weathering pattern which gives the rock a honeycomb appearance.

name: French Ridge Track
introduction: After walking up the valley, a challenging track crosses the Matukituki River and climbs through bush to tussock slopes in the sub-alpine zone.
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Lindis Valley tracks
introduction: A range of tracks for walkers and mountain bikers alike, in an attractive, upland valley. Easily accessed off SH8 between Tarras and Omarama.

name: Lodestone summit
introduction: Climb to the top of Lodestone (1462 m) and enjoy spectacular views of Tasman Bay and the Arthur Range.
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: North Egmont day tramps
introduction: These scenic day tramps offer views of Mount Taranaki and down across the Taranaki Ring Plain to the coast.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Long Gully Loop Track
introduction: Weave your way through dramatic rock bluffs to the Long Gully Bluffs Conservation Area to get fantastic views of Lake Dunstan and the St Bathans Range - it's a steep but rewarding climb.

name: Makarora Valley Track
introduction: Experienced trampers can walk to the 4-bunk Makarora Hut, taking in the Stewart Falls along the way.
locationString: Makarora area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Dingle Burn Peninsula Track
introduction: The Dingle Burn Peninsula Track is a pleasant walk to the Turihuka Conservation Area. It also provides access into Hāwea Conservation Park via the Dingle Burn and Hunter River Tracks.

name: Chalice–Goulter Track
introduction: Follow the Goulter River from Lake Chalice.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Arahura & Styx valleys tracks
introduction: The Arahura and Styx valleys are popular areas for tramping and hunting. The main access in both valleys is via benched formations constructed during the early gold mining days.

name: Rodger Inlet Track
introduction: This difficult tramping track leads to a hut, then a route heads for the bushline at Lake Monowai, Fiordland.
distance: 10 km to hut, 3.5 km to bushline
walkDuration: 6 hr to hut, then 4 - 5 hrs to bushline
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Otawa Reservoir Track
introduction: A well defined track leads to a small clearing beside Te Puke's original water source.

name: Pukenui Forest tracks
introduction: Cross through farmlands and native forest before climbing up a steep ridge and bringing you back to the forest entrance. An easier family friendly option is available.

name: Deerford Track to Makiekie Creek
introduction: Walk to picturesque Makiekie Creek for a picnic and a paddle.
walkDuration: 1 hr 30 min return or 3-4 hr full circuit
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Deliverance Cove Track
introduction: The two possible routes on this Castlepoint walk offer spectacular views as you climb above the lagoon to the base of Castle Rock - it's suitable for children.

name: Harataonga area tracks
introduction: There are a number of tramping tracks in the Harataonga area, which offer great views of the island and surrounding coastline.

name: Stafford Bay Route
introduction: The tracks and routes in the Stafford Bay area can be challenging and are recommended for fit and well-equipped trampers.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Green Lake Track
introduction: This tramping track leads to a hut at attractive Green Lake in Monowai, Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Greenstone and Caples tracks
introduction: The Caples and Greenstone tracks start from the car park at the end of Greenstone Road, 86 km from Queenstown, via Glenorchy. Alternatively, they can be started from Howden Hut on the Routeburn Track.

name: Grey River Nature Trail
introduction: Walk through mixed tawhai/podocarp forest on this short, easy walk - with a picnic area nearby this is a good option for children.

name: South Borland Track
introduction: This short tramping track goes between Borland Lodge and 6km along the Borland Road, Monowai, Fiordland.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Monowai/Borland Road area

name: Te Paki Coastal Track
introduction: This scenic track follows the rugged coastline of Cape Reinga and descends to Te Werahi and Twilight beaches. Self-sufficient camping is available.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only
locationString: Cape Reinga/Te Rerenga Wairua, Te Paki Recreation Reserve

name: Te Rereatukahia Hut Track
introduction: Grass clearings and an old fence are a legacy of days gone by when this section was highly modified by burning and farming.

name: Urupukapuka Island Walk
introduction: This walk around Urupukupuka Island features great views - it's suitable for older children.

name: Otawa Trig Track
introduction: Enjoy a walk through attractive lowland forest dominated by tawa and rewarewa.

name: Tuahu Track
introduction: This is an east-west crossing of the Kaimai Ranges used since the 1890s linking Katikati and Te Aroha. It can be walked in either direction.

name: Stockyard Cove Track
introduction: This is a pleasant, short walking track in Hope Arm on Lake Manapouri, leading to either West Beach or the waterfalls above the cove.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

name: Albert Burn Hut Track
introduction: From the mouth of the Albert Burn follow the farmed river flats into the gorge and on to the Albert Burn Hut.

name: Whakaipo Bay tracks
introduction: Walk or ride over the headland between Whakaipo and Whangamata bays and enjoy the lake views and native bush.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Denniston walking tracks
introduction: Take a historic walk on the same tracks that residents and miners used over a hundred years ago in the coal mining township, and explore the many relics still present.

name: Pouakai Crossing
introduction: Wind across the lower slopes of the Mt Taranaki - discover towering cliffs, a mighty waterfall, a sphagnum moss swamp and stunning views on this day walk version of the popular 2–3 day Pouakai Circuit.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Moanui, Koranga, Tawa Track
introduction: This loop track provides options for an overnight tramp with children or a multi-day tramp.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Te Maire Loop Track
introduction: The track is temporarily closed as the swingbridge at the start of the track has been washed away.

name: Te Kuri Farm Walkway
introduction: Enjoy panoramic views from various points on this track, as well as from a lookout point at the top (290 m).

name: Papatahi Crossing
introduction: Fit and experienced trampers can cross the Remutaka Range via Papatahi (902 m) from mid-Orongorongo valley to the Wairarapa side of the Remutaka Forest Park.

name: Mitre Flats Track
introduction: The Barra Track follows the Waingawa River to Mitre Flats and Mitre Flats Hut.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Minchin  Pass Route
introduction: This route travels the eastern and northern flanks of Arthur's Pass National Park. The sections through the upper Minchin Stream and Townsend Creek are more adventurous.

name: Manuoha to Waikareiti Track
introduction: The Manuoha-Waikareiti Track is a spectacular and challenging walk suited to reasonably experienced trampers. The 32 km walk takes a minimum of three days to complete.

name: Edwards - Otehake Route
introduction: A  transalpine route that mixes the best of east with the wilds of the west.

name: Lake Ōhau area tracks
introduction: There are plenty of tracks around Lake Ōhau for walking and mountain biking. This is a stunning location in both summer and winter.

name: Mt Owen tracks and routes
introduction: At 1875m Mt Owen is the highest peak in Kahurangi National Park and on a fine day the views from this peak are spectacular.
distance: Courthouse Flat to Granity Pass Hut - 8.3 km
walkDuration: Northern access: 9 hr, Southern access 7 hr

name: Old Man Hut Circuit
introduction: This circuit via Old Man Hut makes a good weekend tramp.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Mangamate Loop Track
introduction: The loop covers a range of track types including multiple river crossing. This makes it an ideal introduction to backcountry tramping.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Waikakaho/Cullen Creek Walkway
introduction: This walkway follows an old goldminer's trail across the range between the Wairau Valley and Linkwater. It can be walked or ridden in one day, but you will need to arrange transport between the road ends.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Croesus Track
introduction: Croesus Track is one of the finest surviving examples of a miners' track (1881) on the West Coast. Visitors can also experience what life was like for miners by staying in historic Croesus Top Hut, or by visiting the Garden Gully Hut.

name: Glenorchy Walkway
introduction: This short walk over a beautiful wetland has plenty of bird life and is great for kids.

name: Whataroa, Butler and Perth valleys tracks
introduction: The Whataroa, Butler and Perth river valleys tracks and routes provide rugged backcountry opportunities for those with suitable skills and experience.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Outram Glen to Lee Stream Walk
introduction: A very pleasant forested walking track that follows the Taieri River round to the confluence of Lee Stream with the river.

name: Grandview Ridge tracks
introduction: Highly visible over a large area of the surrounding landscape, the Grandview Ridge provides a spectacular vantage point for views over the upper Clutha Valley and peaks beyond.

name: Nevis Valley tracks
introduction: Access the Remarkables Conservation Area on these tracks.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Historic Haast to Paringa Cattle Track
introduction: This track was built in 1875 by farmers at Haast. Stock were driven from the Landsborough and Cascade valleys to sale yards at Whataroa, a two-week journey at best. It’s now a three-day tramp.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Haast,  Paringa and Moeraki rivers area
locationArray: Haast, Paringa and Moeraki rivers area

name: Glenroy Water Race Track
introduction: The track follows the historic Welshmen’s Water Race through several creeks, then steadily climbs to Ben Cruachan with good views of Lake Wakatipu, the Basin and Nevis Bluff.

name: Oxenbridge Tunnel Track
introduction: A short easy walk to a viewpoint that overlooks the historic Oxenbridge Tunnel river diversion and an old steam engine.

name: Tautuku walks
introduction: Three walks on and around the very scenic Tautuku Bay.

name: Yeoman's Track
introduction: This forest track follows an old route where logs were once hauled to Yeoman’s Mill. It is open to walkers and mountain bikers.

name: Paihia School Road Track
introduction: A pleasant walk through regenerating forest to a lookout that offers stunning views over Waitangi, the Bay of Islands and Russell.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Paengaroa Scenic Reserve Walk
introduction: Take a short stroll to a picnic spot in this reserve renowned for its unique and rare and endangered flora.

name: Taurewa Track
introduction: Follow old milling trails through the bush.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Pā Road Walk
introduction: The short Pā Road Walk links Pā Road to the Kerikeri Basin.

name: Tawa Grove Walk
introduction: Tawa Grove is a bush track specially designed to be an easy walk suitable for all abilities.
locationString: Catchpool Valley & Orongorongo Valley, Remutaka Forest Park

name: Tokenui to Te Waiti Route
introduction: This route leads through the middle of the Urutawa Conservation Area. As it is rough and gorgy in places it is recommended for experienced trampers only.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Tomahawk Lagoon/41-Peg Track
introduction: Climb or moutain bike to Soldiers' Monument above Tomahawk Lagoon and take in commanding coastal views.

name: Milford Track
introduction: The northern end of the Milford Track is closed due to severe damage from flooding in February 2020, however the southern section can be walked as a 3-day, 2-night hike.

name: South Coast Track
introduction: This track of varying difficulty leads along rugged southern Fiordland coast to Port Craig (easy overnight) and beyond to the more remote Big River (4 days one way).
walkDuration: 7 hr to Port Craig, 4 days to Big River

name: Croydon Bush tracks
introduction: There are several tramping opportunities available in Croydon Bush Scenic Reserve.

name: Kirwans Track and Waitahu Valley
introduction: The walk up to Kirwans Hut is one of New Zealand's classic overnight tramps.  A three day loop can also be made by going down the Waitahu Valley.  There are incredible historic relics to be seen in this area.

name: Kawakawa Bay tracks
introduction: The K2K and Orakau tracks both take you into the picturesque Kawakawa Bay; walk or ride the trails separately, or link them together for a longer day out.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Lake Dive Hut tracks
introduction: Enjoy great views up the mountain and down to the Taranaki Ring Plain and the coastline on route to picturesque Lake Dive.

name: Mananui Tramline (Mahinapua Walkway)
introduction: This flat, easy walk or mountain bike ride, suitable for children, follows an old logging tramline and passes beautiful Lake Mahinapua.

name: Tongariro Northern Circuit
introduction: Explore the volcanic heart of Tongariro National Park, a landscape of stark glacial contrasts and alpine views.

name: Waitaia Track
introduction: Once extensively logged and mined, a regenerating coastal forest now greets visitors as they walk along the Waitaia Track.

name: Rangiwahia Hut - Deadmans Track
introduction: An easy to moderate overnight tramp to Rangiwahia Hut on the Whanahuia Range in Ruahine Forest Park. Return via the open tops and Deadman’s Track.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Manawatu Gorge Loop Track
introduction: This is an easy loop walk through bush a short distance from Palmerston North - it's a good option for families with children.

name: Mount Somers Track
introduction: The Mount Somers Track provides a number of options, including for kids, for an overnight tramp with impressive rock formations, historic mines and stunning views. It links the popular Pinnacles and Woolshed Creek huts.
locationString: Hakatere Conservation Park, Mount Somers area

name: Mt Richardson tracks
introduction: Climb to the summit of Mt Richardson (1047 m) for great views to the Puketeraki Range and over Lees Valley.

name: Richmond Trail
introduction: Enjoy stunning views of Lake Tekapo while walking or riding this track.

name: Te Ara Pātaka/Summit Walkway
introduction: Enjoy magnificent views over Banks Peninsula, the Canterbury plains, Southern Alps and Pacific ocean on this track, which is about an hour's drive from Christchurch.

name: Cascade Saddle Route
introduction: The Cascade Saddle Route is an alpine crossing recommended for experienced trampers as a fine weather, summer route
locationString: Matukituki Valley area, Mount Aspiring National Park

name: Ahuriri Valley Track
introduction: This track follows the Ahuriri River. Three huts on route provide several options.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Casey Saddle - Binser Saddle Route
introduction: This is a pleasant 2 day tramp, crossing easy saddles on well-defined tracks through open mountain beech forest.

name: Moonlight Pack Track
introduction: The Moonlight Pack Track offers the opportunity to see reminders of the gold mining history of the area, and to walk through West Coast native beech forest.

name: Akeake Historic Reserve Track
introduction: The track starts from Opito Bay and splits into a series of short, easy walks suitable for children - visit a small beach in the Te Puna Inlet and a pa site on Tareha Point.

name: Huxley valley tracks
introduction: The Huxley valley branches off Hopkins valley in Ruataniwha Conservation Park.

name: Ewe Range Track
introduction: The Ewe Range Track provides walking access to the northern end of Oteake Conservation Park.

name: Falls Creek Route
introduction: A challenging tramping route from the Milford Road into the Falls Creek valley, surrounded by impressive Fiordland mountains.
walkDuration: 4 hr to bush edge, 6 - 8 hr to rock bivvy
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Paparoa Track: Pororari Hut Track
introduction: Walk to Pororari Hut for 360 degree views and experience a shorter (overnight) version of the Paparoa Track Great Walk.
distance: 16 km one way | 17.1 km one way
mtbDuration: 2 hr 30 min - 3 hr 30 min one way

name: Wanganui valley tracks
introduction: The Wanganui River valley provides rugged backcountry opportunities for those with suitable skills and experience.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Upper Copland Valley Track
introduction: The Upper Copland Valley Track provides access to Douglas Rock Hut. It is suitable for well-equipped and experienced backcountry trampers and mountaineers only.

name: Wangapeka Track
introduction:
The Wangapeka route crosses Kahurangi National Park - it
crosses two saddles and travels through the beautiful beech-forested valleys.

name: Wilkin Valley - East Matukituki Traverse
introduction: This route crosses Rabbit Pass to connect with the East branch of the Matukituki River. It is suitable for experienced alpine trampers. Only attempt in good conditions – even then extreme care is required.

name: Wilkin Valley tracks
introduction: These tracks follow the upper reaches of the Wilkin Valley and can be treated as a separate tramping trip or connect with, say, the Gillespie Circuit. It can also lead to a route to the Matukituki Valley.

name: George Sound Route
introduction: This very challenging tramping route goes from Lake Te Anau across to George Sound, Fiordland.

name: Mt Fyffe and the Seaward Kaikōura Range
introduction: Summer-bare or plastered with winter’s snowy coat, Mount Fyffe and the Seaward Kaikōura Range dominate the Kaikoura skyline. They provide recreation opportunities ranging from a family stroll to a serious backcountry journey.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.
locationString: Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence, Kaikōura area
locationArray: Ka Whata Tu o Rakihouia Clarence

name: Pearl Harbour to Hope Arm Track
introduction: The track leads through beech forest to a very pleasant bay on Lake Manapouri, with a great swimming spot and hut.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

name: Tableland Circuit
introduction: Rock shelters, an open tussock plateau and tops with superb views, combine to make this an interesting overnight tramp with options for children.
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: Waima Main Range Track
introduction: This rugged and challenging track passes over some of Northland's highest points and offers occasional views over the surrounding forest and mountain range.  Listen to Kokako around the Oraora Saddle.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Inland Track
introduction: Inland Track travels through regenerating and undisturbed forest where tui, bellbirds and other wildlife can be seen. Occasional granite outcrops offer excellent views of the coast.

name: Pelorus Track
introduction: The Pelorus Track in Mt Richmond Forest Park offers walkers 3-4 days of hard tramping through forest and along the river.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Port FitzRoy: Warren's and Bridle Tracks
introduction: Warren's Track is a gently graded climb to a waterfall and good swimming spots.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Port FitzRoy: Kaiaraara Hut side tracks
introduction: These tracks all start from Kaiaraara Hut, a short distance from the end of Kaiaraara Bay Road, near Port FitzRoy.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Hapuakohe Walkway
introduction: The Hapuakohe Walkway can be done as a 2-day trek, split by the Kaihere-Ohinewai Road. Smaller sections can be completed within a day. It is suitable for experienced trampers only.

name: Kiko Loop Track
introduction: This short loop track is a great way for walkers and mountain bikers to experience the variety of nature in the Kaimanawa Forest Park.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Kiriwhakapapa Loop
introduction: This loop walk passes through regenerated native forest - it's well-graded and suitable for children.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Hinehopu/Hongi's Track
introduction: This track highlights the area's incredible native forest and cultural importance.  Beautiful beach at Korokitewao Bay (Lake Rotoiti) for swimming and picnicking.
locationString: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves
locationArray: Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoma Scenic Reserves

name: Hihikiwi Lookout
introduction: Walk to this lookout point on Mount Pirongia for one of the best vantage points over the west coast harbours.

name: Tawarau Forest tramping tracks
introduction: The limestone features and native vegetation in the Tawarau Forest can best be seen by walking on one of the forest's scenic tracks.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Mangaweka Scenic Reserve Track
introduction: Enjoy great views over the Rangitikei River terraces on this short loop walk that's suitable for children.

name: Mangawhai Cliffs Walkway
introduction: The rugged beauty of New Zealand’s coast unfolds with panoramic views offering spectacular photo opportunities along this walk from the shoreline to the clifftops. It's suitable for children and is one of our best short walks.

name: Ōtaki Forks short walks
introduction: These easy walks are great for kids - there's a campground and hut nearby to stay at too.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.
locationString: Ōtaki Forks area, Tararua Forest Park

name: Matemateāonga Track
introduction: Penetrate deep into the wilderness of the Whanganui National Park on old Maori trail and settlers’ dray road. Shorter day and overnight opportunities are also available.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Pouakai Circuit
introduction: Egmont National Park’s premier 2–3 day tramp offers spectacular views of Mt Taranaki and the surrounding countryside. The 25 km track passes through forest, alpine tussock fields and the unique Ahukawakawa Swamp.
locationString: Egmont National Park, North Egmont area

name: Billygoat Circuit
introduction: This track offers views of the surrounding countryside and evidence of the logging era.

name: Renfrew Roadend to Table Flat Roadend
introduction: Climb up and over the tussock tops of the Whanahuia Range in Ruahine Forest Park then drop down to follow the Oroua River valley.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Lake Waikaremoana: Panekire Bluffs
introduction: Climb up to Panekire Bluffs for magnificant views of Lake Waikaremoana and the surrounding mountains.

name: Whirinaki Track
introduction: Walk through beech forest to lowland podocarp forests on this premier Whirinaki track.

name: Moerangi Track
introduction: This shared-use track includes an overnight stop at an historic hut and amazing views from the top of the Moerangi saddle (955 m). Listen for the piercing calls of kiwi at night.

name: Mount French Track
introduction: Climb to the top of Mount French for spectacular views of Lake Brunner and the Southern Alps.

name: Mount Te Kinga Track/Ara O Te Kinga
introduction: Climb to a lookout for spectacular views, or continue to the summit of Mount Te Kinga (fit and experienced trampers).

name: Tuahu kauri walking tracks
introduction: These short walks feature kauri trees and are great for children.

name: Port FitzRoy: Cooper's Castle Track
introduction: Walk to a lookout with extensive views.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Toaroha, Hokitika, Lower Whitcombe Track
introduction: This route traverses rugged river valleys and crosses two alpine saddles. The alpine sections demand experience and good route finding skills in other than fine weather conditions.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Titri Creek Track
introduction: See hundreds of wading birds on this family-friendly short walk into the Titri wetands.
locationString: Dunedin area, Waihola - Taieri Mouth area

name: Tiritiri Matangi Island walks
introduction: See a variety of native birds on the walks on this pest-free island, as well as views of the surrounding islands.

name: Upper Clutha River Track
introduction: Walk or cycle along the banks of the Clutha River near Lake Wānaka.
dogsAllowed: Dogs allowed. Keep dog under control at all times.

name: Point Elizabeth Walkway
introduction: A stunning, well surfaced, coastal walkway. Enjoy walking through varied and interesting forest to a panoramic, cliff top viewing platform. Point Elizabeth track is a perfect walk for families and children.

name: Kepler Track
introduction: Vast tussock-covered ridgelines and spectacular alpine vistas contrast with peaceful lakeside and valley beech forest in this wilderness adventure.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area,Lake Te Anau area

name: Kepler Track: Carpark to Dock Bay and Brod Bay
introduction: This easy track follows the first part of the Kepler Track (a Great Walk) around the Te Anau lake shore to two lovely swimming and picnicking - it's great for children and they can earn a Kiwi Guardians medal too! Catch a water taxi one way for a shorter walk.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Te Anau area

name: Kelly Knight Hut Track
introduction: The track to Kelly Knight Hut crosses farmland to the Ruahine Forest Park boundary, then sidles above the Pourangaki River to reach the hut via a swingbridge. Stay a night and return the same way.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit for recreational hunting or management purposes only

name: Pearl Harbour to Back Valley Hut Track
introduction: A tramping track leading through beech forest to Back Valley Hut near Manapouri, with a side trip option to peaceful Lake Rakatu.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Lake Manapouri area

name: Dore Pass Route
introduction: This challenging tramping route leads from the Milford Road to Glade House on the Milford Track, via Dore Pass.
locationString: Fiordland National Park, Milford Road/Milford Sound area

name: Ellis Basin Route
introduction: Enjoy extensive views of the Ellis Basin and the surrounding mountains on this track to Ellis Hut.
locationString: Kahurangi National Park, Mount Arthur area

name: Harper Pass Route
introduction: Harper Pass was the main pathway to and from the west coast for Māori when trading for pounamu (greenstone). Follow this historic route from west to east.
locationString: Arthur's Pass National Park, Lake Sumner Forest Park

name: Taranaki Falls Walk
introduction: Walk to Taranaki Falls (20 m) and enjoy excellent mountain views and a range of land forms on a loop track.
locationString: Tongariro National Park, Whakapapa Village area

name: Mount Herbert Walkway
introduction: Enjoy spectacular views of Banks Peninsula from the Mount Herbert/Te Ahu Patiki summit.

name: Whites Bay tracks
introduction: Whites Bay has walks for a range of abilities, including kids - there are rocky areas for scrambling and exploring and a near-flat sandy beach that's excellent for swimming too.

name: Pakihi Track
introduction: The Pakihi Track is a stunning 20 km journey through lush Eastland forest.
dogsAllowed: Dogs with a DOC permit only. Contact the relevant DOC office to obtain a permit.

name: Queen Charlotte Sound walking tracks
introduction: From a 10 minute jaunt to a swimming beach to hour long round trips, the walking tracks of Queen Charlotte Sound give you a range of options.

name: Leatham Molesworth Route
introduction: This mainly unmarked loop route travels the Leatham Conservation Area and into the magnificent Molesworth Recreation Reserve, traversing mountain tops and tussocky valleys.

name: Rainbow Falls Walk
introduction: This short, easy walk suitable for buggies, leads to the stunning Rainbow Falls on the Kerikeri River.

name: Rakaia Gorge Walkway
introduction: This walkway offers several geological and historic features as it traverses the edge of the Rakaia Gorge.

name: Queen Charlotte Track
introduction: Experience the spectacular Marlborough Sounds whilst walking or biking the Queen Charlotte Track. The track stretches 70 km from historic Meretoto/Ship Cove through to Anakiwa in the Grove Arm of Queen Charlotte Sound.
